loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives and works in Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult, and contributes to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food from wild mangrove forests and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Rebecca is married, and has two children. Both her and her husband have green jobs: he sells solar lamps, while Rebecca runs a business selling eco-friendly cookstoves. In addition to this, Rebecca also farms, and she is currently tending to an orange orchard on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will pollinate her crops, thus increasing production.

This is Rebecca’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help buy a hearing aid for her son, Peter. Her hope for the future is to expand her eco-friendly stove business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat lives near Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Josphat is married, and has two children. Both he and his wife run a used car business, and also tend to tree plantations on their land. He likes beekeeping because it offers him a chance to learn about bees while simultaneously expanding his income streams. 

This is Josphat’s first loan, and he plans to use the money generated by his beehives to help repair and maintain his car. His hope for the future is “to be able to advertise my car sales business on the internet.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives near Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border with Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Maureen is single, and is working to establish an agricultural research business. She is currently tending to a tree plantation on her land, and is looking forward to having bees because they will have a positive impact on her trees through pollination. 

This is Maureen’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to create a profile for her business, including a website.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Samuel is married, and has four children. His wife works as a teacher while Samuel runs a stationary business selling textbooks, pens, notebooks, and other office supplies. He has been farming for six years, and is currently tending to an orange orchard on his land. Samuel is excited to start beekeeping because it will provide him with a “source of clean, pure honey.”

This is Samuel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to help him expand his stationary business. In the future, Samuel hopes “to train the community on honey use and production.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion-fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Francis is married and has two children. His wife works selling eco-friendly cookstoves, while Francis sells solar-powered lamps. He has been farming for six years, and is currently tending to a tree plantation on his land. Francis is excited to become a beekeeper because it will give him “a source of honey for medicinal use.”

This is Francis’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start a poultry farm. In the future, he hopes to save up enough to buy more land for tree plantations.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Tabbydha

texts.en:
Tabbydha lives in Mwachande, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Tabbydha is married and has two children. Her husband works in the beekeeping industry, while Tabbydha herself works as a community development officer. Tabbydha has been farming for eight years, and is currently growing tree plantations on her land. She likes beekeeping because “bees complement food production through pollination.”

This is Tabbydha’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to pay college fees. Tabbydha’s hope for the future is “to include beekeeping as part of the community trainings that I conduct.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Thomas is married, and has one child. He and his wife both farm their land and are relatively new farmers, having been farming for only five years. They are currently growing maize, horticulture crops, and bananas. Thomas is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because he sees it as good project that produces income with little labor investment. 

This is Thomas' first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to start a poultry farming project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Mary is married, and has eight children and many grandchildren. Her husband used to work as a teacher, but he has since retired and now they both farm their land. Mary has been farming for 35 years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables as well as tending to a fruit orchard. 

This is Mary’s first loan with Kiva, with which she plans to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production. She plans to use the increased income to care for her late son’s children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua lives on a farm close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistics and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Joshua is married and has eight children. His wife is a homemaker, while Joshua farms their land. He has been farming for thirty years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables, as well as tending to an orchard on his land. 

This is Joshua’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay for his grandchildren’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lornah

texts.en:
Lornah is a 50-year-old lady from Oile park within Kisumu, Kenya.She is divorced and supports five people in her family. Her youngest child is 12 years old.

Lornah sells second-hand clothes within the Kisumu market. She has been doing this business for the last sixteen years and gets a monthly income of 18,000 KES (Kenya shillings). She is requesting a loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to add more stock of second hand clothes. Lornah will use the anticipated profit to increase her capital and educate her child.

Her dream is to have stable income from the business so as to support her family.

loans.use: to add more stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is single, and aged 32. She has been selling both fruits and vegetables for the past one year. She wants the loan to buy more beans and vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different types of clothes to sell, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and help in improving the family's standard of living. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to get her own shop, since she has been sharing this one, and start selling wholesale. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more different types of clothe to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and a single mother of two children who are in school.

She has a salon business in Naivasha which she has operated for five years, and she has applied for her second loan from Kadet ltd to enable her to purchase a dryer. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and expand her business.

She hopes to see her children well educated in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dryer.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en: Thamer is 21 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba with his 3 siblings and his parents. Thamer is studying in his 3rd year for a Bachelor of Agriculture Engineering degree. He is planning to continue his study to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a woman of sixty-one years. She is a widow blessed with two children. She operates a food kiosk in Kiambu. She has been in this business for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of approximately sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's second loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire amount to buy stock for her food kiosk, like soft drinks, sugar, cooking flour, etc. In the future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Annes

texts.en:
Annes is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a green grocery where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations by suppliers. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, bananas, onions and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will have a large business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, bananas, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Hugo Jean Carlos Yorgo

texts.es:
Hugo es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 19 años y vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también encontramos playas hermosas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, sus pobladores poseen una habilidad para la preparación de platillos ya que su comida es deliciosa y sobre todo tienen una alegría muy contagiante. Cuando Hugo tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, pero en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz chaufa con wantan frito”.

Día a día Hugo trabaja como obrero en un taller de mecánico, el labora alrededor de 6 horas al día, ya que por las tardes él se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

hugo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una moto para poder movilizarse a su centro d elabores, ya que su vivienda se encuentra alejada, asi podra ahorrar y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Hugo is a hard working young man and above all is eager to get ahead. He is 19 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, a town which is characterized by a warm and welcoming climate and which also has beautiful beaches and is home to grand glories of Peruvian sports. Its residents have a knack for preparing dishes; their food is delicious and above all, they display contagious joy. 

When Hugo has a bit of free time, he loves to watch TV, but sometimes he also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, which is the delicious “Chaufa rice with fried wonton”.

Every day, Hugo works as a laborer in a mechanic's shop. He works approximately 6 hours a day and in the afternoons he studies at the university. He believes that he is doing well in his job because he is very responsible and, above all, he has much desire to get ahead. 

Hugo is very grateful to Kiva investors, because, thanks to their help, he can buy a motorcycle to commute to his place of work. His home is located in a remote area and having a motorcycle allows him to make savings and to keep working towards the realization of his great dream: "To complete his career and have his own house."

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is 20 years old. She lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Salt with her 4 siblings and her parents. Hiba is in her 3rd year of studying for a Bachelor of Hotel Management degree. She is planning to continue her study to work in her study field after graduation in order to start helping her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 8 children, with 6 of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Alex has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the shop, such as milk and bread to sell, and will help Alex to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to enlarge the business more. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop, such as milk and bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a sprayer and to pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Aulelerie

texts.en: Eurelie is married with three children. She is 67 years old. She has requested this loan to buy more cooking oil, flour and tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She is very thankful for the previous loan, and has been successful in the profits she obtained.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, flour and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and running a general store. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Libellee

texts.en: Libellee is 28 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband works as a driver. She sells vegetables, and with this loan she will buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the sales will be used to expand the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 20 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Irbid with his 3 siblings and his parents. Ahmad is in his 3rd year of studying for a Bachelor of Drama degree. He is planning to continue his study to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Maria Cleofes

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 54 años de edad de ella no depende nadie y en compañía de su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo que sus padres le brindaron; pero no pudo seguir por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a trabajar la tierra en donde es cultivada la hortaliza como también el café. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y también las bodegas en la zona urbana donde es vendido su producto directamente. Sus cultivos están ubicados a pocos metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie para dar asistencia técnica para evitar daños en sus cosechas.
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos como ser: abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos ya que con este apoyo podrá proteger sus cultivos de café y hortalizas y estará más seguro de plagas entre otros.
Su sueños es mejorar día a día sus cultivos poder incrementar un poco más sus cosechas en variedad y calidad ya que ella generaría más ganancias para poder reparar su casa de habitación la cual es necesario ya que necesita repello entre otros.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old.  She lives with her husband and has no dependents.  María completed primary school, thanks to the efforts, dedication and support that her parents provided her.  However, due to a lack of money, she was not able to continue past this point.  María has a lot of experience in farming as her parents taught her to work the land form a very young age.  María grows vegetables and coffee.  Her customers are different buyers who come to the area and also the warehouses in the area, which sell directly to customers.  María's crops are just a few metres from her home, and she arrives there every day by foot, in order to maintain the crops and avoid damage to her harvests.

Today María is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as manure, fertilisers, and other items for maintaining her crops.  With this support María will be able to protect her coffee crops and vegetables, and can avoid plagues and other problems.

María's dream is to improve on her crops every day and to increase the quality and variety of her crops.  With this she would be able to earn higher profits in order to make repairs to her home.  This work is necessary as she has to whitewash her home.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yessenia Marina

texts.es:
Yessenia es una joven de 22 años de edad casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales aún no tienen la edad para estar en pre kínder o primaria. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo en un terreno que es propio gracias a los ahorros y a DIOS y está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan por lo que el mantenimiento a sus cultivos es más fácil incluso su asistencia técnica. Los clientes para su producto ya desganado y limpio son las diferentes bodegas y pulperías en otros municipios fuera de donde ella habita.
Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros que darán protección a sus cultivos de maíz siendo estos su único medio de ingreso para el fortalecimiento en la economía de su hogar.
Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que la semilla nueva se pueda pegar y la planta crezca sana y fértil facilitando el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Su sueño es como toda madre apoyar a sus hijos cuando estén en la edad escolar en todo lo necesario y evitar que pasen por la misma situación que ella.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 22 years old, married and a mother to two children.  Both the children are too young to be going to kindergarten yet.  Yessenia was able to complete primary school thanks to support from her parents. It was her parents that taught Yessenia to grow corn, beans, and coffee.  She currently makes a living growing corn alongside her husband.  He is her only support on the land.  Yessenia, thanks to God and her savings, owns the land that she works.  The plot is on the same land where the family lives.  This makes looking after the crops and helping them to grow easier.  The people who buy Yessnia's clean and healthy products are the different warehouses and grocery stores in the municipalities around where she lives.

Yessenia currently needs help to buy supplies such as manure, fertilisers, and other itmes that will protect her corn crops.  This is Yessenia's only source of income for strengthening the family's financial situation.

Yessenia has plans to improve her land and lay manure, so that the new seeds can stick and the plants grow healthy and fertile.  This will help with maintaining the crops.  Yessenia's dream, like any mother's, is to support her children once they are in school, with everything they need.  She dreams that they will not drop out of school like she had to do.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her corn crops.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 17 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gonzalo Hernan

texts.es:
Gonzalo de 62 años de edad nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia La Matriz, vive en la actualidad solo ya que desde hace unos tres años se separó de su esposa con quien procreó un hijo que en la actualidad tiene 19 años y vive con su madre en Quito la capital del Ecuador.
Desde muy chico le gustó mucho la música y aprendió a tocar la guitarra, habilidad que heredó de  su padre, el mayor obstáculo en su vida ha sido la separación con su esposa y el alejamiento de su hijo, por el momento está solo y en sus ratos libres se dedica compartir sus habilidades dando clases de guitarra por las tardes, por la situación económica se ha visto en la necesidad de solventar sus gastos de esta manera, además Gonzalo es muy hábil en este arte, también da asesoramiento cultural en instituciones educativas,  de cuatro a cinco horas, en toda su carrera ha producido 5 CDS con su propia autoría, ha recibido auspicio de pocas empresas e instituciones e incluso personales, razón por la cual hoy nos está solicitando un crédito para poder concluir con su séptima producción.
Su mayor sueño es poder volver a ver a su hijo y poder esta con él, para Gonzalo fue muy duro y difícil el tener que separarse de su esposa e hijo, pero pese a todo esto no se ha dado por vencido y ha tenido de luchar solo para poder subsistir. 
Hoy necesita de nuestra  ayuda para que le podamos solventar con un crédito la producción de su nuevo CD. Quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para felicitar y agradecer a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a KIVA por el apoyo y financiamiento, el mismo que será de mucha utilidad para su crecimiento en su vida profesional y personal.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 62 years old and was born in Latacunga, within the Matriz parish.  He has been living alone for the past three years, after having separated from his wife.  They have a 19 year old son who lives with his mother in Ecuador’s capital of Quito.

He has liked music very much since he was a child and learned to play the guitar from his father.  The biggest obstacle to his life has been his separation from his wife and being far from his son.  He is alone at the moment and he gives guitar lessons in the evenings in his spare time.  He has decided to earn money to pay his expenses this way, due to his financial situation.  Gonzalo is very good at this and also works as an advisor in cultural institutions between four and five hours.  Throughout his career he has produced five CDs of his own and has received recognition from a few companies and institutions, as well as some personal ones.  He is asking for a loan to be able to produce his seventh CD.

His biggest dream is to be able to see his son again and be with him.  It was very difficult for Gonzalo having to separate from his wife and son, but aside from all this, he has not given up and has had to struggle only to be able to support himself.

Now he needs our help with a loan so he can produce his new CD.  He also wants to thank Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for the support and financing.  They will be very helpful toward his personal and professional growth.

loans.use: to produce a CD.

loans.name: Ándres

texts.es:
Ándres de 35 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 5 años de edad y 7 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 9° grado y su esposa es ama de casa, todos los dias ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, prepara el desayuno, despacha a sus hijos a la escuela.

Ándres es agricultor. Aprendio e oficio de sus padres, la parcela en la que trabaja  esta ubicada a 300 mts de la vivenda, trabaja durante toda la mañana. Su esposa, en casa ordeña los animales y vende la leche, después dedica su tiempo a cuidar los animales.

El préstamo será usado para comprar una vaca lechera, producir mas leche y que su venta ayude a los ingresos de la familia.

En un futuro, Ándres quiere construir su propia casa de ladrillo, actualmente vive en una de adobe y en invierno filtra el agua.
texts.en:
Andres is 35 years old, married and has two children, aged seven and five years old.  Andres only completed up to ninth grade.  His wife is a housewife.  She wakes up every morning at 4am to prepare breakfast and send the children out to school.

Andres is a farmer.  He learned this trade from his parents.  The land that he works in 300 metres from his home, and he works there all morning.  His wife, back at home, milks the animals, and sells the milk.  After that, she spends her time looking after the animals.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and to produce more milk, the sale of which will help the family's income.

In the future, Andres would like to build his own house out of brick.  The family currently lives in an adobe house and, in the winter, water comes in through the walls.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nghien

texts.en:
Nghiem was born in 1995. He lives in Bac Ninh province, Vietnam. His major at Bac Ninh University of Sport is physical training. (http://www.upes1.edu.vn/).  His course lasts 36 months and he will be graduated in 2017. His education fees are subsidized by his parents. Nghiem plans to find a part-time job to earn more money to help pay his education fees. 

His family has four members. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and to learn at the university. His mother grows rice and his father is a driver to earn a living. His mother is shown with him in the posted photo. His family’s income is about 9,000,000 VND per month. Nghiem has a passion for his major because he wants to contribute his efforts to his country's education. He wants to continue until the end of this university course. He understands that learning helps him to have opportunities to get a high-paid job to help his parents. 

He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay his education fees and to buy more study equipment to support his studying. He wants to send a sincere thanks to donors around the world, and he hopes donors will go to Vietnam to understand deeply about the Vietnamese people and the country.

loans.use: to pay his education fees and buy more study equipment to support his education.

loans.name: Assoukowe

texts.fr:
Assoukowe est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur. 
Assoukowe travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1987. Elle vend des poissons fumés et frits pour tous clients à la maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Assoukowe a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Assoukowe voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assoukowe is a 46-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer.

Assoukowe has been a retailer herself since 1987. Working alone, she sells fried and smoked fish from her home to a wide variety of customers. She buys her stock in Lomé. At the moment, her greatest difficulty is not being able to accommodate all of her clients.

Assoukowe has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Twiyunguruze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Marius  fait partie du groupe  Twiyunguruze II  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a  42 ans et est marié  à Stéphanie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4 à 13 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  brochette de chèvre   depuis 20 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 2 chèvres pour préparer beaucoup  de brochette  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait avoir une boutique et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marius, age 42, is a member of the group Twiyunguruze II and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a merchant named Stéphanie, and they have four children aged 4 to 13 who all go to school.

Marius has been selling goat kebabs for 20 years. This is his first loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the credit to bolster his working capital. He will buy two goats to make a large quantity of kebabs to sell, thereby boosting his revenue.

In the coming years, he would like to have his own shop and to see his children pursue their studies.

loans.use: to bolster his working capital and buy two goats to make a large quantity of kebabs to sell and boost his revenue.

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is 41 years old, married,  and has five children. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a bus driver. Reema’s son is studying for Bachelor of Law 2nd year. He is planning to continue his studies to work in his field after graduation in order to start helping his parents financially.

Reema is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.  She and her husband are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for their son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 31 years old. She is married with two children, and they both go to school. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale as she has been in this business for the past two years. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. 

For the past eight years, Esther has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and it will help Esther to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. 

Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to open other branches of the same business. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en:
Madelene is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Madelene is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Madelene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en: A wonderrful woman by the name of Fazilat lives in a house that has bad conditions. She is divorced. She has a daughter who is 7 years old. Her daughter wants to live in a house that has good conditions, but Fazilat's income from selling dried fruits is not enough for it. She must to repair all rooms of her house. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month, she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is 23 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her six siblings and her parents. 

Reham is studying Bachelor of History, third year. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her study field after graduation in order to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She has been selling various items in her business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, lotions and various items to put in her boutique for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for the future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, lotions and various items for sale.

loans.name: Mezna

texts.en:
Because Mezna is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Mezna was born in 1956. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her seven children and her husband. Her husband is a retired man. 

Mezna’s son is studying for his Bachelor of Business Administration in his second year. He is planning to continue his studies to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his parents financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them in paying their son's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Mezna applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en:
Mahina is married and has one child. She always wanted to provide him with a good education. Her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, so she decided to start a new business of sewing in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied at the course of "To Get Ahead" at a women's organization and acquired business skills. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a sewing machine for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Camelia

texts.en:
Camelia is a 27-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. 

She has been working as a private teacher since 2011. She works at her home where she meets with her students to teach them by discussing educational subjects and solving problematical questions. In parallel, she has been working at a local clothing store for almost one year with the aim of earning a supplementary income and be able to live in good conditions. 

With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will re-equip the teaching room that she prepared at her house with new supplies for her students. In the future, she wants to work at a local proper school and focus on the teaching profession since this is what she loves, and to earn enough income and develop her career in the most excellent way.

loans.use: equip the teaching room with new supplies.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife. He has no children yet, but he is planning to have kids soon. Recently, he became the owner of a car wash, where he provides customers with clean and hygienic car wash services. He has one part-timer working with him. In parallel, he sells coffee to people from his community. 

Today, Rami is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase modernized tools, paint his car wash and install a curtain to be protected from rain and keep the cars sparkling. In the future, he plans to expand his operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools, paint his car wash and install a curtain.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie d'un Banc Villageois qui est créé le 14 décembre 2008.Il est composé de seize femmes qui sont solidaires.Leur activité dominante est le commerce.



Dior la représentante est  âgée de 48 ans . Elle est mariée mère de cinq enfants dont un garçon de 18 ans; sa fille aînée est âgée de 27 ans. Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de tissus, sacs et chaussures. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite la main levée.

Elle achète les tissus, chaussures,sacs et autres articles divers dans la capitale et revend dans sa ville.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter pour 150 000 F de tissus et 50 000 F de chaussures pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus. Dior souhaite un jour devenir une grande commerçante.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle va renforcer son épargne afin de bénéficier d'un prêt plus consistant.
texts.en:
This group is part of a Banc Villageois that was created on December 14, 2008. It consists of 16 women who share a bond of solidarity. Their main activity is commerce.

Dior, age 48, is the group’s representative. She is the married mother of five children, one of them an 18-year-old boy. Her eldest daughter is 27 years old. Dior sells fabrics, handbags and shoes. On the photo, she is the lady standing on the right with her hand raised. She buys her merchandise in the capital and conducts her sales locally, in her own town.

Dior will use her loan to buy 150,000 F worth of fabrics and 50,000 F worth of shoes in an effort to increase her revenue. She hopes someday to become a prominent merchant. 

She plans to use her profits to bolster her savings in order to qualify for more substantial loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer was born in 1986. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a governmental entity. His current work is a weak source of income that is not enough to cover his children's needs. 

Abeer has been sewing clothes and selling them since her childhood. She started her project by buying a sewing machine and started sewing a small amount of clothes, and she found this project profitable and a good support for her family. She is planning to open her own workshop in the future. 

Now she needs to buy more fabrics and straws to raise her productivity and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and straws to raise her productivity and income.

loans.name: Mounir

texts.en:
Mounir is a 60-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. 

He has owned a coffee mill since 1997. He is quite familiar with the process of producing delicious coffee grains. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials and continue his production properly. Mounir is very brave at his job and believes that this first Kiva loan will definitely help him realize what he is aiming for.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for coffee production.

loans.name: Ma. Jenelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Ma. Jenelyn earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of gasoline to sell to customers.

Ma. Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of gasoline to sell to customers.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a wonderful woman. She is married and has three sons. 

Marhabo and her husband try to work hard and earn money for living. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. She works with this deal with pleasure. She likes animals. She was born and grew in the village, so she has a great experience in this field. She buys animal in the local market and fattens them in her barn. After some months, she resells the animals in the local market. Her husband helps her with the business. 

Marhabo wants to buy cattle to increase her working capital, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni). She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Zenaida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional grocery products to sell.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman was born in 1979. She is married and is a mother of six children. Her husband sells vegetables. 

Eman has been selling clothes for 1.5 years. She started her business by selling a small quantity of clothes and she found it profitable and a good support for her family. 

Eman is planning to open her own clothes store in the future. To do so, she needs good income which she can get from selling a larger quantity of clothes. But, she doesn't have enough money to buy a larger quantity of clothes to sell. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en: Theophile is 29 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Gogita

texts.en:
Gogita is a 27-year-old, single man from Georgia's second largest city, Kutaisi. He works as an entertainer at the local children's center and he gets a monthly salary. Gogita lives with his parents. He is a very energetic and cheerful young man, with a great desire to get ahead. 

Gogita is requesting a loan to start up a store in his city, where toys and jewelry will be sold. Gogita will hire the commercial space and purchase a stock of merchandise. He will stock his store well to attract customers. According to Gogita's estimation, the business will be lucrative and will generate additional income.

Gogita hopes to win your favor.

loans.use: to start up a store where jewelry and toys will be sold.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is a father of two children. He is 27 years old. He sells vegetables and has been dealing with this business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, Theogene would like to buy more vegetables to sell. He plans to use the profits to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bread in the Philippines and she earns additional income from tricycle transportation. 

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of bread to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and other supplies, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and only child. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1986. He works independently transporting customers to their desired location. In addition, he provides private transportation to nearby countries. 

With his loan, requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will perform the needed maintenance on his car to be able to carry on with his business safe and sound. In the future, he plans to replace his car with a new one and expand his work geographically.

loans.use: perform the needed maintenance on his car

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 32 years old. She is married and has four children. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She is very happy with her previous loan, which has helped her in expanding the volume of her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and beans for resale.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a 49-year-old, married man. He lives in a small village in Gori district with his wife and two children. His children go to a local school. 

Vazha and his wife are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and a plot of agricultural land where they grow different kinds of vegetables. 

Vazha decided to purchase a mini-tractor and begin his own business. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 800 to purchase a mini-tractor. He will get orders from his villagers to cultivate the land and he will generate income. 

The start-up program will be a great support to his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.en:
Munisa is not married. She lives with her parents and tries to help them by earning money for a living. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry three years ago. Munisa perfected her ability with the passing years. 

Munisa wants to develop business and to earn more income. She requested a loan in the amount of 4,000 TJS to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase the number of animals she has for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells stew in Batanya (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about fifteen years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family.

 Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of stew ingredients thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of stew  ingredients

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Batanya (near Cape Coast). Abena is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

 Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of smoked fish. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of smoked fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fried fish in Batanya (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. 

Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is married and has one child. She has received some schooling until the end of high school. Currently, Olivia sells phone cards in Batanya (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about four years now. Her husband is a driver. Olivia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Olivia will use this loan to increase her existing phone card capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Olivia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing phone card capacity.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her family and herself. 

Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She is a food vendor in Batanya (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. 

Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of food. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of food.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en: Germaine is 29 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells different items in her boutique, and she would like to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, rice, and salt for resale. The profits from her business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Choijiodser

texts.en:
Choijiodser is a 23-year-old man who lives with his wife, Nansalmaa, who helps him to run their family business in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His daughter Namuun is 2 and stays at home. 

Choijiodser has been quite a craftsman since he was in high school and he officially started his wooden furniture and Ger parts manufacturing business at home in 2012. He has hired two other striving craftsman and now he is running his business successfully. Choijiodser needs additional inventory to meet recent orders and he is requesting loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase more inventory and other necessary materials to fulfill his clients' orders on time. He is a hardworking, diligent, and confident man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and other necessary materials to fulfill his clients' orders on time

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa was born in 1973. She is single and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Marka. Sanaa has been selling clothing at her house for 1 year. She started her project by selling a small quantity of them and she found it profitable and a good support for her. 

She is planning to do good marketing for her products. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of clothing in order to raise her sales and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Zhuzhuna

texts.en:
Zhuzhuna is 42 years old and lives in the village of Dandalo, in mountainous Adjara Region. She is married and lives with her husband and two school-age sons. 

Zhuzhuna works as a librarian at the school, located in the neighboring village, and she gets approximately USD 65 per month. In addition, the family runs a small-scale agricultural business and owns a dairy cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. The cheese is sold from their house.    

Zhuzhuna wants to supplement her family's income by renovating her house, so she can rent it out seasonally. Her house is located near the university and several students have already expressed an interest in living there, but she has been unable to get a loan from several local financial institutions to pay for renovations. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Credo, which help people who do not qualify for conventional loans. 

Zhuzhuna will use the loan to buy the materials she needs to renovate her house. She hopes that renting out the rooms will be profitable and will increase her income, so that she and her family members can improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate the house, so that it can be rented out.

loans.name: Raeefa

texts.en:
Raeefa was born in 1971. She is a divorced woman who lives in a part of Jordan called Marka with her family. One of her brothers works at a hotel. Raeefa has been selling home products for three years. She started her project with a small quantity of products trying to support herself financially after her divorce. 

Now Raeefa is planning to expand her business and would like to buy a larger quantity of home products, such as plates and glasses, to raise her profit and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Raeefa applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products, such as plates and glasses, for her business

loans.name: Chuluunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbold, 49 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ger in the Mongolian province of Uvs. Chuluunbold has been working as an electrician for years with a local company. His wife Erdenechuluun has been producing inner felt for traditional boots by order at home for three years, and has built close relationships with her suppliers and clients. His two older children are university students, while the two youngest are still in high school but will soon be going to university. 

Chuluunbold's wife needs extra money for her cobbling business since winter is coming and clients are starting to order warm traditional boots. He is therefore requesting a 3,000,000MNT loan on her behalf to purchase large amounts of leather, sheep skin and other materials to produce the boots before winter's arrival.

Chuluunbold's is a big, happy, hardworking family pursuing higher education in their future.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of leather, sheep skin and other materials to produce traditional boots for clients before winter

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. 

She prepares and sells 'kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her kenkey in Batanya (near Cape Coast). She is the sole breadwinner in the family. 

With the loan, Aba will purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud was born in 1983. He lives in a rented house with his five siblings and his parents. Mahmoud has been selling soft drinks and fresh juice at his own store. He started his project by working as an employee at a cafe. Then he owned it. He is planning to raise his income in the future by adding variety to his products. 

Now Mahmoud needs to buy a new juice machine to raise his productivity and to sell different types of juices. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, Mahmoud applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a new juice machine for his business

loans.name: Okash Group

texts.en:
The four members of Okash group live in a working-class neighborhood in the city of Taiz, Yemen. The whole group took out a loan of 120,000 YER. 

Libia, the coordinator of her group, is 38 years old. She has operated a business selling fabrics and perfumes, etc. Libia`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan from AMB to buy perfumes, incense, and fabrics for her business. She hopes to increase her profit in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense, and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is an experienced, private entrepreneur from the village of Pambak, in the Lori region. She lives with her husband, her son, and her daughter-in-law. 

Alvard has run a local grocery store for more than 18 years. In her store, she sells different grocery products, flour, and sawdust. Alvard is the only breadwinner in the family. Her husband and son help her in organizing her business.

To be able to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Alvard needs to make some investments. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, and will enable her to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store. The latter will make Alvard’s store more competitive. 

Alvard relies on the goodwill of the lenders and she will be thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Felicia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling wakye (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves). She usually sells her wakye in Batanya (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling wakye for four years. 

Felicia is married and has six children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Felicia wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty wakye. 

In the long term, Felicia plans to reinvest the future profits in her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani was born in 1984. She is single and lives in a part of Jordan called Salt with her four siblings and her parents. One of her brothers works as a teacher at a governmental school. Amani has been selling foodstuffs and candy for eight months. She started her project with a small quantity of products, trying to support her family financially. 

Now Amani is planning to expand her business and would like to buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and candy to raise her profits and income. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and candy for her business

loans.name: Salsabeel

texts.en:
Salsabeel was born in 1994. She is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt, with her five siblings and her parents. 

Salsabeel has been selling foodstuffs and candy for the past two years. She started her business with a small quantity of food, trying to financially support her family. 

Now, she is planning to expand her business and would like to buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and candy to raise her profit and income. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and candy for her business.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Santa Eulalia Group

texts.es: “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE SANTA EULALIA” es un grupo nuevo conformada por 06 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio minorista. Luz tiene 42 años es conviviente con 03 hijos educando hace 04 años se dedica a la compra y venta de reciclaje como son: botella descartable, papel, fierro, cobre, bronce y aluminio. La actividad a la que se dedica ahora Luz es por iniciativa de su esposo quien decidió emprender dicha actividad. Luz en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de zapatos para niños a pedido de sus clientes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de un triciclo. La nueva meta de Luz es tener un depósito grande. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Luz es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Las Emprendedoras de Santa Eulalia is a new group comprising six members who work in different retail businesses. Luz is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and is raising three children. She has been working buying and selling recycling materials such as disposable bottles, paper, iron,copper, bronze, and aluminum, for four years. Luz is in this business on her husband's initiative, since he decided to start it. In her spare time, Luz works selling children's shoes to order. She will invest the loan in purchasing a tricycle. Luz's new goal is to have a large storage place. 

The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Luz is the first person from the right.

loans.use: to buy a new tricycle

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga lives in Arkhangai province of Mongolia with his wife and a daughter in a 'ger', a traditional nomadic yurt. His wife Gantuya and daughter Nyamjargal helps him to run their family business of recycling materials and animal pelt retail business in local market. They have been running the business for years and have lot of experience and built their retail channel. 

He is now requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other products in bulk and sell to local manufacturers. Battulga's are a happy and hardworking family.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, therefore helping him to prepare more of his tasty gari.

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Mrs.Dolgor is a 38-year-old, female head of the family. She lives with her four children in Ger, on her uncle's plot of land in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her children are between 8 and 15 years old and they all attend local school. 

Dolgor has been doing everything for a living and she has now started her groceries and clothing sales business in a rental workplace. She has great sense in dealing with various types of people and a lot of experience in running a smaller business like this. 

Dolgor needs extra money of MNT 5,000,000 to run her recently started store in a rental place, to provide her children with a decent living and education. She is a hard-working, confident, and strong woman.

loans.use: to run her recently started store in a rental place, to provide her children with a decent living and education.

loans.name: Freddy Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando tiene una actividad muy peculiar ya que el señor Fernando fabrica de papel de algodón para todos los dibujantes donde puedan acceder el arte de pintura. Donde el señor Fernando comercializa dicho papel en todo el territorio boliviano. Por el cual requiere capital de operación para elaborar mayor cantidad y mejorar la actividad. Vive en una casa en alquiler y requiere ambientes mas amplio para mayor comodidad y generar mayor desarrollo.
Tiene estudios hasta el bachillerato y el estudio técnico de su profesión, no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos y es responsable  de sus obligaciones.
La actividad que proporciona es dinámica para su empleo, ya que realiza con mucho esmero el arte de dibujo en papel de algodón, así como se muestra en las fotografías.
El señor Fernando tiene nuevos diseños que sobresalen y sorprenden al publico por su creatividad que desenvuelve por su experiencia que realizo en el transcurso de su vida.
texts.en:
Fernando has a very unusual business as he makes cotton paper for all artists which they can use in the art of painting. Fernando sells this paper across the whole of Bolivia and for this reason he needs working capital in order to produce a larger quantity and improve the business. 

He lives in a rented house and needs more space in order to be more comfortable and develop his work more. He has completed high school studies and technical studies for his profession. He does not have dependent children and meets all of his financial obligations. This work that he does drives his business, and he puts great care into the art of drawing on cotton paper, as can be seen in the photo. Fernando has new designs which stand out and surprise the public because of his creativity, which has developed from the experience he has had during the course of his life.

loans.use: working capital ( to buy materials for making cotton paper).

loans.name: Yossellyn Verenisse

texts.es:
Yossellyn es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho empeño trabaja en una institución de su ciudad como empleada, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su universidad ya que actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de derecho y le va muy bien; Yossellyn cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo quiere progresar.

Yossellyn está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá pagar las mensualidades de su universidad, y de esta manera no tener contratiempo para poder asistir a sus clases, así ella seguirá estudiando y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder apoyar a su familia y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yossellyn is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead, so she works diligently in an institution in her city.  With the fruit of her labor she's able to pay her university expenses.  Currently she's studying law and it's going very well for her.  Yossellyn believes it's going well for her at work because she's very responsible and wants to move forward.

Yossellyn is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to pay her monthly university fees.  This way she won't suffer any setbacks in being able to attend her classes.  She'll continue studying and striving to make her big dream come true, to be a great professional and be able to support her family and have her own house.

loans.use: to pay her monthly fees

loans.name: Ravi

texts.en:
Ravi is 43 years old and has a family that includes three school-aged children. He does rice cultivation while his wife has a small shop outside his house where she sells food and beverages.

Ravi has been a client of Seva MFI since 2008 and has already received nine small loans. He repaid those on time. This enabled him to pay for the tuition of his children and even buy a second hand pickup truck, which he needs for his rice production. He needs a new loan of SRD 9.000 to expand his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es: Gloria, a sus 39 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Trabajó durante varios años en una empresa de telecomunicaciones, pero cuando tuvo su segundo hijo hace 2 años, decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio de comidas, ya que siente un gusto especial por la actividad gastronómica, adicionalmente aprendió a preparar yogurt y, con la venta de estos productos que elabora y otros ya elaborados, obtiene los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer pujante y emprendedora que siempre busca opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por ello se motiva a solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito como apoyo para comprar los insumos al por mayor (frutas, leche, azúcar, envases plásticos), adquirir una nevera portátil y sacar el registro invima que le exigen para poder comercializar sus productos, de esta forma podrá aumentar su producción y vender más productos porque garantizará la buena calidad del producto que ofrece y los clientes se sentirán más seguros al consumirlos, esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ingresos. De esta forma, Gloria desea terminar de ampliar la cocina para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y en un futuro cercano poder adquirir un vehículo para transportar los productos que comercializa y realizar las entregas de una manera ágil y oportuna, dando paso a la generación de mejores recursos económicos con los que podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 39, has two children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner.  She worked for several years for a telecommunications business.  However, when she had her second son two years ago, she decided to become independent and start her own food business.  She has a special liking for the culinary business.  Additionally, she learned how to prepare yogurt.  With the sale of these products that she makes and others that are already made, she gets the income needed to pay for the basic household necessities.

Gloria is a vigorous and enterprising woman who always looks for options that will allow her to get ahead.  That is why she is requesting her first loan cycle.  She will use the loan to buy supplies wholesale (fruit, milk, sugar, plastic containers), to get a portable refrigerator, and to register with INVIMA [National Institute of Medicines and Nourishment], which is required in order to sell her products.

This way she will be able to increase her production and sell more products because she will guarantee the good quality of the product that she sells.  The customers will feel safer about consuming them.  This will be reflected in the increase of her income.  This way Gloria wishes to finish expanding her kitchen in order to improve her working conditions.  In the near future she will be able to get a vehicle to transport the products that she sells and to make deliveries in an expeditious and timely fashion.   This will lead to the generation of improved financial resources with which she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fruit, milk, sugar, plastic containers), to get a portable refrigerator, and to register with INVIMA.

loans.name: Lachmipersad

texts.en: Lachmipersad is 44 years old. He grows rice and vegetables. He has a second-hand tractor that he inherited from his father. In 2008 he started producing rice seed with a loan from Seva MFI. He became a well-known farmer and seed supplier for a good number of rice producers who are clients of Seva MFI. Through the sale of seed he has renovated his house and is saving to buy a new tractor. He asks for a new loan of 10,000 SRD to purchase inputs for seed production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lekhram
