She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like sugar, edible oil, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, and soap. Her business started one year ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy various supplies, like eggs, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries, to attract more customers at the same time and maintain the inventory of her store.   

In the future, Jenelyn would like to expand her business and increase her business profitability for her child’s education and to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various supplies, like eggs, soft drinks, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna’s interest in fitness began when she first joined a kickboxing club. After working out there for several years and later becoming a certified instructor, it was a natural progression for Joanna to open her own franchise.

The statewide kickboxing club is a cardio-intensive total body workout that began in the 1990s in Hoboken, New Jersey. Joanna believes in the exercise program, and she wants to help others achieve self-confidence and strength. Recently, Joanna hosted an outdoor kickboxing workout, which was a great success and brought about 30-35 attendees.

Since April 2013, Joanna has managed a full-time administration job in New York, in addition to owning this business franchise. A trained Zumba instructor and AFAA-certified group fitness instructor, Joanna is now pursuing another certification on obesity and exercise. 

Eventually, Joanna would like to be able to dedicate herself full-time to her franchise and to open additional franchises as well. The funds of this loan will go toward facility and labor expenses associated with running this new business.

loans.use: to pay for facility and labor expenses for her fitness club.

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is a 36-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She is into multiple businesses, like raising cattle and hogs and farming, to earn a living to help her husband, who is a carpenter. 

Ma. Merlinda needs additional capital to sustain her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed for her hogs and piglets to raise. 

With the additional capital, she will be able to support her household's needs like food and electricity.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es:
El Joven Carlos, de 32  años vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de  Nacaome, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08  años a la venta de ropa como ser pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa de niño, vestidos, capris, pantalones  de hombre y de mujer.
Carlos sus clientes son personas que le visitan el su negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal de Nacaome. 
Carlos está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de ropa como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, blusas y calzonetas ya que quiere seguir trabajando y crecer más en su  negocio, su sueño comprarse un carro para poder transportar su mercadería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, lives in his house located in the neighborhood of  Nacaome, Valle in the southern part of Honduras. 

For the past 8 years he has sold clothes such as pants, shirts, skirts, children's clothes, capris and pants for men and women. 

His clients are people who come to his business located in the market located in the Nacoeme municipality. 

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and bathing suits since he wants to keep working and growing his business. His dream is to buy a car so he can transport his merchandise. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and bathing suits for his business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buying and selling vegetables business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school. Anita works very hard to provide for her children.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc. Anita has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 54 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gloria has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, chicken, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, flour, spices, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been working in fishing business along with her husband for more than 8 years now. She is also engaged in seaweed farming. This is the source of their income.

Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the school fees of her children. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market and improve their seaweed farming as well. In the future, Gonzala hopes to expand their ventures so that they will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional seaweed seedlings and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La  señora Reina  de  42 años vive  en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa. 
Doña Reina quiere invertir más en su negocio para así poder tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de ropa como pantalones, faldas, camisas, trajes de niño, camisetas de tela y pantalones, capris, sandalias, zapatos de niño, vestidos, etc. 
Doña Reina tiene varios pedidos que le han hecho y necesita tener la mercadería para poder entregarlo a tiempo y así poder seguir aumentando más su negocio.
Su sueño mejorar mas su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Reina is 42 years old. She lives in her house in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. She has worked selling clothes for several years. Reina wants to invest more in her business so she can have more products to offer her customers. She is asking for the loan to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, children's suits, and t-shirts and pants, capris, sandals, children's shoes, dresses, etc. 
 
Reina has several orders and she needs to have merchandise to be abel to deliver on time and keep growing her business. Her dream is to improve her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, children's suits, t-shirts and pants, capris, sandals, children's shoes, dresses, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a 44-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel in Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 21, 19 and 17. She engages in selling kitchen wares and other dry goods. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy 10 dozen pairs of pants, 5 dozen pairs of shorts and 5 dozen t-shirts to maintain the inventory of her store. It could attract more customers as well.
   
In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of pants, 5 dozen pairs of shorts and 5 dozen t-shirts.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: Rosendo desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en el campo, primero al lado de su padre y hermanos y ahora lo hace junto con sus hijos. El café que produce es orgánico y de calidad de exportación. La época de cosecha se acerca y solicita un crédito que utilizará para pagar a cortadores de café, pues es demasiado el trabajo que hay que realizar en las fincas y es imposible que él y sus hijos lo hagan solos. Rosendo y su familia también cuentan con un vivero de planta de café, la cual venden a productores de su localidad.
texts.en:
Rosendo has worked in the field since he was very young, first at the side of his father and brothers, and now with his children. The coffee he produces is organic and of export quality. 

Harvest season is approaching, and he requests this loan to pay for coffee pickers. There is a lot of work to carry out on the farms, and it is impossible for him and his children to do it alone. 

Rosendo and his family also own a nursery of coffee plants, which they sell to local producers.

loans.use: to pay for coffee pickers

loans.name: Alfredo Valentin

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja como obrero de un fundo agrícola y con los ingresos de su trabajo puede salir adelante, Alfredo cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrado.

Alfredo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para construir la parte posterior de su casa para poder dar mayor seguridad a la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera dar mayor tranquilidad a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 24 years old. He works as a laborer on an agricultural estate, and with the income from his work he is able to get ahead. Alfredo believes that his work is going well for him because he is responsible and honest.

Alfredo is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy materials to build the rear part of his house in order to give better security to the home where he lives and in this way give greater peace of mind to his family and continue striving to make a reality of his great dream: to study to be a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es:
Oscar de 35 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo sus padres le pudieron dar el estudio hasta un bachillerato técnico, luego tubo que trabajar ya por su cuenta, trabajando la agricultura y otras actividades jornales que le ayudaran a ingresar dinero a su familia. Su esposa, tiene una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, con los que le ayuda a los gastos en la familia. Sus dos hijos están estudiando uno primaria y el otro octavo grado.

Oscar posee una pequeña joyería, en compañía de un familiar en la ciudad con mucho esfuerzo y mucha perseverancia la pudo fundar. Esta actividad la aprendió hace como 10 años, le enseño un amigo quien se dedicaba a esta actividad, tubo que pagar para aprender esta profesión. Ademas, cuando tiene poco trabajo se dedica a trabajar como albañil, ya que su padre  le enseño esta actividad, y los fines de semana es cobrador de un autobús que transita en las comunidades cercanas, donde vive. Todos los días, se dirige muy temprano a su pequeño taller en la ciudad a 4 kilómetros de su casa y llega por las tardes, cuando tiene mucho trabajo lo lleva para su casa y tiene que desvelarse toda la noche, para salir con el tiempo con los pedidos que le solicitan. 

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para construir las paredes a la champa donde a instalado la tienda de su esposa.  Actualmente, ella solo saca una parte de la mercadería y la otra la deja al interior de la casa, por que es muy pequeño el espacio en donde esta ubicada la tienda. 

Él espera para el futuro,  expandirse en su pequeño taller de joyería, instalar otro taller en diferente lugar para ayudar con mejores ingresos a su familia, y espera darles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is 35 years old. With much effort, his parents were able to give him an education with a technical degree. Later he had to work on his own i agriculture and other daily activities that helped him bring in income for his family. His wife has a small store in their house and with it she helps pay for the family expenses. His two children are in primary school and another is in eighth grade. 

Oscar has a little jewelry store with a relative in the city. With a lot of hard work and perseverance, he was able to open it. He learned this activity about 10 years ago. A friend who did this activity taught him and he had to pay to learn the profession. In addition, when he has little work he works as a bricklayer, since his father taught him that activity. Weekends he is a collector for a bus that goes through the communities close to where he lives. Every day he goes out very early to his little workshop in the city 4 kilometers from his house and he comes back in the afternoon. When he has a lot of work he takes it home and has to stay up all night so he can get out on time with the orders.  

The money from the loan will be used to t build walls on his wife's store. Right now, she just takes out some of the merchandise and leaves the rest inside the house because he space where she has the store is very small. 

He hopes that in the future he can expand his little jewelry store, setting up another store somewhere else to help with the family income. He hopes to give his children an education, if possible, a college education.

loans.use: to build walls where his wife has set up her store.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Joan has been in this business for 17 years. Joan earns extra income from videoke, a rental karaoke machine.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma Judith es casada. Cuenta con 35 años de edad. De escolaridad 6to. Primaria. tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando. Ella se dedica a la fabricacion de Jabon Negro, tambien conocido como Jabon de coche(esto se utiliza para bañarse). Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de los jabones. Desea en el futuro ampliar su capital de trabajo y que su fabrica crezca y distribuir por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a al comercio y a elaboracion de Jabon Negro.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Judith is married. She is 35 years old. In school, she completed sixth grade. She has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She works making black soap, also known as car soap (this is used for bathing). She began this business with a little capital that she had saved up, and up to now she has 5 years of experience. She has the support of her husband.

She organized a group and is applying for a loan that will be used for the purchase of raw materials to make the soaps. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital, have her production grow, and sell wholesale.

The other members of the group work in business and in making black soap.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make soap

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

Nena has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Roneta

texts.en:
Roneta is married with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roneta is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Roneta has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Roneta requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Roneta has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Roneta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works hard to support her family. Adela is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Adela requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing boat motor for her business.

Adela has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Adela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat motor for her business

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty Group

texts.es:
Caaguazu Poty es un grupo muy trabajador, se formaron como propósito el crecimiento de cada una de las integrantes, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvia, quien tiene un kiosco y también vende comidas. Es un ejemplo esta señora debido al esfuerzo que hace, no solo para tener más ingresos, sino también para poder crecer en las capacitaciones que recibe.
Las señoras de este grupo además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer cómo se encuentra cada una en sus economías, y conforme eso trabajar.
Silvia por su parte pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su kiosco, como ser comestibles, golosinas, bebidas y demás, y así seguir trabajando por mejorar y también por superar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Caaguazu Poty is a group of hardworking women that was founded to facilitate the financial and personal growth of each one of its members.  Silvia is a member of this group.  She has a shop where she sells food.  She is an example to those around her because of the effort that she puts into her work not only to obtain more income but also to use what she gets to grow.

In addition, the women in this group are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey, which aims to understand the economic standing of the group members and find ways to improve.

Silvia is asking for a loan so she can invest in buying supplies for her shop such as food, sweets, drinks, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to continue working towards overcoming her poverty.

loans.use: buy food, drinks, and other things.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian home) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Tungalag and her husband, Chuluunbaatar, are starting their own animal pelt retail business. Her daughter, Anujin, studies at a local school. Tungalag and her husband have been working locally for years, since 2001, and have a lot of experience. They collect animal pelts from herders and sell to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city. They act as middlemen and make a profit out of it. Tungalag is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelt from herders in countryside and sell it to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelt from herders in the countryside and sell it to manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.name: José Concepción

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, cuando era un niño su padre lo abandono, su madre solo pasaba trabajando en el campo, para conseguir el sustento diario, y nunca se preocupo de mandarlo a la escuela. Por esa razón, no sabe leer ni escribir, desde muy chico aprendió el oficio de agricultor y cría de ganado, todos los años siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y tiene varias reses, también trabaja como vigilante en una hacienda.

Para comprar sus reses, don José, tiene que pedir permiso en su trabajo, para ir hasta el tiangue, ya que ahí puede seleccionar animales de mejor calidad; para ello aborda un camión en su comunidad, ahí viaja por 45 minutos hasta llegar, luego de comprar, carga los animales en el camión y regresa a casa.

Don José, solicita $1,600.00, para comprar 3 novillas próximas a parir, para obtener leche para la alimentación de su familia y venderle a sus vecinos.

Si compra sus novillas, don José, podrá tener un ingreso extra, así podrá satisfacer otras necesidades de su familia   

La vida de don José, podrá  cambiar con este préstamo, porque incrementara el numero de reses y obtendrá leche para mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.   

Don José, sueña con tener unas 5 vacas de raza lechera.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, is married, and has 3 children.  When he was young, his father abandoned him, leaving his mother to work in the fields in order to support her family.  She wasn't ever able to send him to school.  For this reason, he doesn't know how to read or write.  When he was very young, he learned how to farm and raise cows.  Every year, he plants 14,000 square meters of corn and he also has many cows.  In addition, he works as a security guard at a ranch.

To buy his cows, José has to ask permission to leave work and go to the market where he selects the best quality cows.  To do so, he gets on a truck in his town and drives 45 minutes to get there.  Once there, he buys the cows he wants, loads them in the truck, and returns home.

José is asking for $1,600 to buy 3 heifers close to giving birth so he can obtain milk to feed his family and also sell to his neighbors.  If he can buy these heifers, José will be able to have some extra income and in this way meet the needs of his family.

José's life will be improved by this loan because it will increase the number of cows that he has and allow him to obtain milk to increase his income and the quality of life of his family.

José hopes to have 5 milk cows.

loans.use: buy 3 heifers.

loans.name: Thang

texts.en: Thang was born in 1994 and lives in Bac Ninh Province. He is majoring in electricity at Electric Power University. His course lasts 18 months and he will graduate in 2014. His education’s fee is subsidized by his parents. Thang plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay for his education. Thang’s family has four members. His mother is shown in the photo with him. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and receive a higher education. His mother is a seller and his father is a construction worker. His family’s income is about 13,000,000 VND per month. Thang has a passion for his major because he is aware that this major is suitable for his personality. He wants to follow until the end of this university’s course. He understands that an education will give him the opportunity to get a high-paying job that will allow him to support his parents. He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to buy a computer to help him with his studying. Thang appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to programs like Kiva, which have supported his education individually and that of the Vietnamese youth in general.

loans.use: to buy a computer to help him with his studying.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael está casado con la señora Edith, tienen 5 hijos, 3 de ellos en edad escolar, viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá, allí surten a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como bebidas varias, lácteos, carne, panificados, carbón, verduras y otros.
El y su esposa son personas muy trabajadoras, y con su esfuerzo están criando a sus hijos, ya que quieren darles un buen futuro, una buena educación, y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien. Este crédito lo pide para la compra de carne, panificados, carbón, verduras y otros.
Cuenta el Sr. Rafael que además él trabaja como empleado de una empresa como jefe de seguridad hace más de 3 años. El señor Rafael es una persona muy responsable y con muchas ganas de mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia, mientras él está trabajando como empleado su esposa junto con sus hijos se encargar de administrar el negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael is married to Edith; they have 5 children, 3 of whom are school-age. They live in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Itá. There, they supply their neighbors and occasional customers with all kinds of basic household goods, like various drinks, dairy products, meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items. 

He and his wife are very hardworking people, and through their efforts they are raising their children, because they want to give them a good future, a good education, and for them to be good people. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items.

Rafael says that additionally, he has worked as a business employee as the head of security for more than 3 years. Rafael is a very responsible person who has a great desire to improve his and his family’s standard of living. While he works as an employee, his wife, together with their children, are in charge of running the business.

loans.use: to purchase meat, baked goods, charcoal, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Imelda is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nylon, etc., for her seaweed-culture business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nylon, etc., for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a seaweed-culture business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional materials for her seaweed-culture business.

Amie has been in this business for seven years. Amie earns more income from food vending, fishing and raising pigs.

Amie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs and goats for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from food vending.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, spices, etc., for her food-vending business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 15 years. Rosalina earns more income from raising pigs.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosario is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosario has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Teresita has been in this business for 24 years. Teresita earns more income from pre-paid mobile load credits.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is a 22-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two young children, ages 2 years old and 9 months old, respectively. Her husband works as a security guard to support their family. She is also engaged in farming. Her business started two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and medicines to yield more harvest. 

In the future, Maria Flor would like  to expand her business and increase the business profitability for her children’s welfare, including good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and medicines.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycad (pedicab) transportation. Vilma is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, rice, etc., for her food-vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a tricycad (pedicab) transportation business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her tricycad business.

Vilma has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her tricycad (pedicab) business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 47 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Gertrudes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

Gertrudes has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 53 years old and is married with four children. He resides in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, along with his family. His wife is a fish vendor, while he manages their own farm to earn a living. He used to grow and harvest coconuts to sell in town and also planted bananas for sale. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. Recently, his farm is in need of fertilization to have a greener and abundant harvest. His income before was used in their daily living and school fees, so he borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer. His future plan is to buy another farm to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita works hard to support her family. Alita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Alita has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Alita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motor cycle

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Antonio, tiene 51 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, desde que tenia 11 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura, aprendió con un tío que lo crío, ya que sus papas no se ocuparon de él, Nunca asistió a la escuela por dedicarse al trabajo para lograr subsistir, actualmente siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, el cual vende en elote, este lo produce con sistema de riego, para lograr 4 cosechas en el año, para efectuar los riegos tiene que ubicar la tubería surco por surco y un riego de 7,000 metros cuadrados lo hace en dos días de trabajo.  

Don Antonio, para comprar sus insumos, aborda un autobús en su comunidad, viaja unos 30 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad.

Don Antonio, solicita $500.00, para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante y otros productos para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego. De esta manera,  podrá comprar sus insumos de un solo viaje, esto le ahorrara tiempo y dinero, ya que le darán precio mas bajo. 

Al tener todos sus insumos en casa, don Antonio, podrá dar un manejo oportuno a su cultivo, esto hará que su cosecha sea mas abundante, y también sus ingresos, así podrá pagar su crédito a tiempo y tendrá comida para su familia   

Don Antonio, sueña con tener unas 3 vacas de raza lechera, para tener un ingreso adicional y alimento para su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has worked in farming since he was 11 years old. He learned the trade from his uncle who raised him because his parents did not take care of him. He never went to school as he needed to work to survive. He currently sows 14,000m2 of corn, and he sells the cobs. The corn is produced using an irrigation system in order to obtain four harvests per year.  To carry out the irrigation, he has to install the pipes in every single furrow and to water a 7000m2 area takes two days. To buy his supplies, Antonio takes the local bus to the city, 30 minutes ride away. He is requesting $500 to buy six bags of fertilizer and other supplies to sow 10,500m2 of corn. With the money from the loan, he will only need to make one trip to buy the supplies, and this will save him time and money as they will charge him less for buying in bulk. Once he has all the supplies, Antonio will be able to take better care of his crops and obtain a more abundant harvest. His income will increase allowing him to pay back the loan and put food on the table for his family. Antonio dreams of having three dairy cows to have an extra source of income and food for his family.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and other supplies to sow a 10,500m2 area of corn on irrigated land.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is 43 years old and married with three children. He lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting mangos to earn a living. His business has been successful and he was able to successfully repay his previous loan and also buy a motor cab with his profits. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and recently, he requested a new loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for his motor cab maintenance. He is hopeful to earn more profit so his business will be successful. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for his motor cab maintenance

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.en:
Cholpon is a student of the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), department of European Studies and here is her story:
“One of my main goals is to explore Europe. I am interested in European history, history of European culture, European literature, and multicultural European society, the rights of the European Union and European languages. I am very interested in European Studies, both on a national and international level, and am determined to promote positive change in my country and region. I am convinced that completion of my studies at the American University of Central Asia will provide me with the capacity to do so. 
AUCA provides the best quality education among Central Asian universities with two diplomas, both Kyrgyz state and Bard college diplomas. Another important point is that I have a high regard for AUCA's liberal arts program as every course is worthy of a bachelor degree. The academic environment at AUCA is welcoming and has responsive instructors who are highly experienced. Studying in the Preparatory Program already gave me the chance to prepare myself for further study at AUCA by improving my English speaking and grammar and most importantly writing skills with the support of my instructors in the Preparatory Program. 
AUCA also provides students with the facilities required for learning and I am sure higher education at this unique university will lead me toward success and a bright future. As a result, according to my academic achievements, personal qualities and social work, I will be able to be a promising student of the AUCA. My previous academic achievements and active participation at my school’s extracurricular activities are examples of my interest in Europe.
Studying at the Preparatory Program made me more enthusiastic to study at AUCA and I know that AUCA is the right place for me.  I chose to study at AUCA in order to have a successful future not only for me and my family but also for my community and country. I am certain that through pursuing my career I can move towards the achievements of my long standing goals of my country’s political, social and economic improvement. And studying at the European Studies Department at AUCA will support me to reach my aims and ambitions. It will also provide the chance and prospect for the fulfillment of aspirations of a Kyrgyz girl who is looking ahead with immense sense of hope for a bright future to be part of the modernization and advancement of my beloved country.
But unfortunately my family is not able to afford the full tuition at AUCA. I need a KIVA loan to make sure that I will not have to struggle with the finance difficulties while pursuing my bachelor degree.”

loans.use: To help pay for my bachelor degree in European Studies

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu lives in the Mariakani area in Kenya. She is a married woman with six children. She runs her own beauty salon in town that has been in operation for more than ten years. She started the business at her residential home and after her husband saw her good work he decided to start a salon for her. She knew Milango through friends and now she is seeking a loan to renovate the floor of her salon. She hopes that the business will grow large in the next five years and she plans to add cosmetics to her product offering. The extra income she will make will be invested back in to the business.

loans.use: to renovate the floor of her salon.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 51 year old woman from the town of San Miguel ,Bohol. She is married with 5 children. The oldest child is 27 while the youngest is 19. Her husband works as a mill operator to support their family. She works to make homemade meals like vegetables guisado, fish soup, and chicken and other meat recipes for customers. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar and dried fish, to continue her business. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her food vending business and increase her business profitability for her children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and dried fish

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is running a general store in Oroquieta City while her husband is working as an OFW. She has been doing this for more than three years as an aid to her husband's income. In 2012, she joined GDMPC and recently, Rachel borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more grocery goods, rice and corn grits and feed to sell. Her future plan is to expand her business and use the profit for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, rice and corn grits and feed to sell

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alpha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods and farming sugarcane. Alpha is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and selling rice.

Alpha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Мухамади 30 лет, является семейным человеком и имеет одного двухлетнего ребенка. Мухамади занимается торговлей более 7 лет. Он имеет свой продуктовый магазин на рынке Гиссарского района, где в частности продает масла, сахар, чай, консервированные продукты, макароны и т.д., а также хозяйственные товары. Он надеется, что его магазин и дальше будет одним из самых востребованных. Для достижения своей цели он много трудился не покладая рук. Мухамади сейчас обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить новый ассортимент продуктов питания и хозяйственного товара для развития торговли. Он ждет поддержки, чтобы заполнить свой магазин товаром. Ему дорог этот магазин.
texts.en: Muhamadi is 30 years old. He is a family man and has one two hear old child. Muhamadi has been in sales for over seven years. He has own grocery store on the market of the Gissar region where he mainly sells butter, sugar, tea, canned products, pasta and other goods such as household products. He hopes that his store will be always in high demand. He worked a lot without rest to reach his goal. Muhamadi has now come to ask for a loan to buy a new variety of food products and household goods to grow sales. He is waiting for support so that he can fill his store with goods. His store is very dear to him.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of food and household merchandise to grow sales.

loans.name: Mahmadzarif

texts.ru: Махмадзариф 33-летний житель района Гиссар. Более 7 лет он занимается животноводством. Махмадзариф разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этот не легкий труд отнимает много времени и сил, но он не боится трудностей, потому что мотивацией для работы служат его жена и трехлетняя дочь, которых необходимо обеспечивать. Мухаммадзариф сейчас нуждается в кредите. Так как ему необходимо закупить пару молодых бычков для продолжения своей животноводческой деятельности. Помогите Махмадзарифу!
texts.en: Mahmadzarif is a 33 year old resident of the Gissar region. He has been doing animal husbandry for over seven years. Mahmadzarif breeds large horned cattle at home. It's not an easy job and takes a lot of time and strength, but he is not afraid of hardship because he is motivated by his wife and three year old daughter whom he has to support. Mahmadzarif needs a loan right now. He has to buy a couple of young calves  to continue his animal husbandry business. Please help Mahmadzarif!

loans.use: to purchase a couple of young calves to continue the animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Ochilboy

texts.ru: Очилбой родом из района Рудаки, ему 55 лет. В настоящий момент он разведен и живет один. У него есть двое детей, которые работают за границей. Очилбой имеет высшее образование. Однако он занимается другим делом. У Очилбоя собственный цветочный бизнес. Он уже 10 лет как в своем цветочном павильоне, расположенном в парке города, продает горшечные цветы и комнатные растения, в частности такие как катарантус, герань, фикус, алиандра, алоэ, фиалка, драцена, спатифиллум, циперус, шефлера и т.д. Его работа приносит ему самому не только доход и удовольствие, но и радость людям. Очилбой сейчас хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент горшечных цветов и комнатных растений.
texts.en: Ochilboy is from the Rudaki region, he is 55 years old. At this time he is divorced and lives alone. He has two children who are working abroad. Ochilboy has higher education, but is doing something else. He has his own flower business. He has been selling potted flowers and house plants such as katarantus, geral, ficus, oleander, aloe vera, violettes, dracena, spatifillum, ciperus and others for over ten years in his own flower shop located in the town's park. His work does not only bring him income and joy, but happiness to others. Ochilboy wants to grow his business. He is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment of potted flowers and house plants.

loans.use: to purchase potted flowers and house plants to grow his business.

loans.name: Shlair

texts.en:
Shlair is a professional hair dresser and beautician with 28 years of experience. She opened her business in 1986 in Iraq. At the time training institutions were only available in Baghdad where she completed her studies and since continued to participate in various trainings to stay up to date with new techniques. She understands the need and finds it important to provide her customers with the best services.

At work as a business woman she has been able to grow her business and employ 3 women; at home as a mother she been a role mother to her two daughters. Both of her daughters are following in her footsteps; one of them is currently working with her while the other has already been able to open her own salon with help from Shlair.   

As she explains with her own words in the video: “My name is Shlair, I am the owner of the salon. I have been working in this field for 28 years after attending some training courses in Baghdad at the Fluna Institute for Beauty. I also went to Jordan for attending an exhibition for Beauty Salon owners and I also worked in Turkey for a little while. I feel happy to work in this field, earn money for my daily life, and I’m proud to have two daughters who have already made their certifications as well. And I plan to expand this beauty shop.”  

She enjoys working with her customers and is happy for having been able to open and maintain a reputable salon. To ensure the salon continues to provide high level services, Shlair decided to take a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $10,000. She would like to update the style of the salon, most importantly to buy new special chairs for both the hairdressing works and for the beautician’s corner. As she explains, the current chairs are very old, hard to work with and one of them is completely out of order with a broken system. She will also use the loan to purchase additional high quality cosmetics and supplies, and based on her customers' requests, she would also like to buy certain items for retail in the shop and this way help her customers gain access to products unavailable in other shops.  

After the upgrade of the salon is complete, Shlair’s long term goal is to establish her salon as a teaching institute for other aspiring women interested to work in the field.

loans.use: to update the style of the salon, most importantly buy new special chairs and equipment

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Experiencing first hand a community level problem effecting many families, Shireen turned a personal need into an enterprise.  

In 2003, working as a teacher herself, Shireen had work commitments until 5pm but was unable to find day care for her young child. The few government provided facilities were inadequate, crowded and would only be open until 1pm – leaving many families in deadlock when choosing between mothers working or staying at home.

With very little money, no support, and many challenges Shireen took matters into her own hands and decided to open a private kindergarten and day care center. While many people would not believe in her potential for success and commented the opening with sour words, she had proved them wrong. The small endeavor had since outgrown its original location and since 2009 operates from 3 small locations – one of which is shown on the pictures.

Shireen now has 10 years experience with managing kindergartens, and 19 years experience as a teacher. She is a mother of two children, but through her business takes care of 200 children with the help of 60 employees. As she explains in the video: “My name is Shireen, owner of this kindergarten which was established in 2003. I established the Kindergarten because when I had my baby I didn't find a place to put her in during my work as a teacher until 5:00 pm. It was the first private Kindergarten in the area. Now there are 60 women working in my Kindergartens and 5 drivers, we created jobs for 60 women. Now we have 200 kids. The Kindergarten work starts beginning of September 2013.”

Shireen works with a small profit margin to ensure her kindergarten’s services are affordable for working families. Continuing to provide services with a high level of attention to details Shireen is taking an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $25,000 which she will use to install a fire alarm system, fix water pipes, and renew some of the furnishing and carpeting as required by local regulations.

Shireen would one day like to also open an orphanage to provide care and education for children most in need.

loans.use: to install a fire alarm system in the kindergarten

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica, who is married with an only child, resides in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. While her husband is working as a private employee, she manages their farm to make a living. She also grows and harvests mango on her farm. Recently, she joined GDMPC and is borrowing 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She knows very well that with this investment, she will earn multiple returns. She plans to use her income to buy another farm and to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. Leonora earns more income from raising livestock.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Shuane

texts.en:
Shuane works hard to support her family. Shuane is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Shuane requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, paint, etc.

Shuane has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Shuane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, paint, etc

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis is married with an only child. He runs a general store while his wife works in a private company to make a living. He has been doing this business for more two years. His customers' demands for more items they want to buy in his store encouraged him to add to his capital. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, bottled products and biscuits for sale. He plans to use his profit to purchase more products for the satisfaction of his clients. In the future, he want to expand his business to have better income for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, bottled products and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед молодой начинающий предприниматель из района Хамадони. Ему 27 лет. Он усвоил технологию производства по переработке хлопка и теперь в своем районе хочет открыть собственный цех по переработке хлопка. Данный бизнес очень прибыльный. Джамшед будет закупать хлопок от своих односельчан. Он уже приобрел помещение для цеха. Джамшед просит кредит, чтобы купить оборудования. Ему не хватает собственных средств для реализации покупки, потому что такая техника стоит очень дорого. Джамшед старается преуспеть и найти источник дохода. Ведь он недавно женился и ждет появления ребенка. По этой причине он неустанно продвигается вперед, чтобы в будущем преуспеть в бизнесе и его семья жила в хороших условиях. Он надеется на поддержку!
texts.en: Jamshed is a young, first-time entrepreneur from the Hamadoni district. He is 27 years old. He has learned the manufacturing technique for processing cotton and now he wants to open his own processing facility for processing cotton in his district. This business is very profitable. Jamshed will buy the cotton from his fellow villagers. He has already bought the space for the facility. Jamshed is requesting a loan to buy equipment. He does not have enough personal savings to make this purchase as this kind of technology is very expensive. Jamshed is trying his best to succeed and find a source of income. This is compounded by the fact that he was recently married and is expecting a baby. For this reason he tirelessly forges ahead so that, in the future, he will be successful in business and his family will have good living conditions. He relies on your support!

loans.use: to purchase equipment for cotton processing in order to open a production facility.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Connie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as sardines, juice, noodles, etc. to sell.

Connie has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Connie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as sardines, juice, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetable to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to have enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad is running her retail store located in Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. Her husband works as a private driver while she manages her fruit stand to make a living. She has been in this business for more than three years. In 2010, she became a member of GDMPC and, recently, Natividad borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more variety of fruits to resell. Her profits from the business will be used to expand her fruit stand.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Luis Jorge

texts.es:
Luis tiene 48 años de edad y trabaja en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad  como inspector, con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo  puede sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos a quienes quiere y lucha cada día para brindarle una vida digna.

Luis está agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han dado podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar pisos tarrajear, paredes entre otros, con lo cual le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a  sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Luis is 48 years old and works for a transportation company in the city as an inspector. With the income he gains from his modest job he is able to bring up his four children who he loves and who he fights for every day to offer them a decent life.   

Luis is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have given him. Thanks to their help, he has been able to buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and more to make home improvements such as laying floors, plastering and other improvements. With this he will be able to give his family a better quality of life and fight so that his dream of making his children into professionals will become reality.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Elyor

texts.ru: Элёр позитивный и дружелюбный мужчина. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Элёр в своё время смог получить среднее образование. Сейчас он работает плотником. Он занимается построением и ремонтом жилищных помещений частных лиц, и от этого получает приемлемый доход. С недавних пор Элёр отделился от своих родителей и живёт со своей семьёй в своём доме. Он недавно построил себе дом. В данный момент Элёр начал бизнес животноводства, чтобы иметь дополнительный хороший заработок, так как доход, который имеет Элёр от плотничества не достаточен для удовлетворения всех потребностей семьи. Сейчас Элёр хочет закупить несколько голов скота для дальнейшего вскармливания и продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку скота. Элёр заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Elyor is a positive and friendly man. He is married and has two children. Elyor was able to receive a secondary education. Now he works as a carpenter. He works in construction and renovating private residential properties. He makes a decent income from this. He recently left his parent's home and lives with his wife and children in their own home. He built his own house not long ago.  Currently, Elyor has started his own business of animal husbandry in order to have additional earnings, as his carpenter's salary is not enough to address all the needs of his family. Now Elyor wants to buy several cows to fatten them up and resell them. This is why he turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy cattle. Elyor thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: El Paclom Group

texts.es:
El señor Manolo Medardo es casado. tiene 27 años de edad. De escolaridad 3ro. Básico. Tiene 2 hijos y no esta estudiando. Se dedica al servicio de estructuras metálicas. Inició este negocio ayudando a su padre y hasta le fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servira para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando herramientas que le facilitaran la fabricacion de las estructuras. Desea en el futuro contar con mejor maquinaria para poder aumentar y facilitar el trabajo.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Mr Manolo Medardo is married and is 27 years old. He completed three years of schooling, has two children and is not studying. He began helping his father make metal structures for work and to date he now has six years of experience in this job.

Manolo has organised a group and requested a loan to help him to increase his working capital to buy tools, which will make the construction of the structures a lot easier. In the future he would like to have better machinery to increase his workload and make the job easier. 

The other members of the group work in the shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for their workshop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa esta casada con Alberto tienen  2 hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, y que les ayudan cuando tienen las posibilidades de hacerlo.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. 
Consiguió montar su negocio con un poco de dinero que había juntado con el trabajo que hace su marido. 
Su marido trabaja como Guardia de seguridad en una empresa privada en el centro de la Ciudad y de esa manera ayuda a Teresa con los gastos del Hogar. 
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio. 
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, arroz, fideo, bebidas y otros con lo que quiere surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa is married to Alberto and they have two children who are already independent adults. They help them out when they have the possibility to do so.

Teresa has a store which is well stocked and very well known in her neighbourhood. She was able to start up her business with a bit of money that she put together from her husband's job. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company in the city centre so he is able to help Teresa with the household bills.

Teresa is a very determined and honest person who is known and liked by everyone who lives in her neighbourhood. She is requesting a loan to invest in flour, rice, pasta, drinks and other items to stock up her store and continue to offer a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, pasta, drinks and other items

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 14 years. Ana Marie earns more income from raising pigs.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
Aidai is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Journalism and Mass Communication and here is her story.
“The American University of Central Asia is the university of my dreams. I planned to enter this university two years ago and since then I have been studying to the best of my abilities to make my dream come true. I have always tried to find out as much information about AUCA as possible. For this I have been surfing the internet, communicating with current students and my aunt, who also graduated from AUCA. I am really happy that I am a student of AUCA now and that I could make it happen. 
Five years ago I could not even imagine that I would enter the Journalism department. I had a great desire to become a doctor. However, I understood with years that I don’t want to devote my life to medicine. I am such a sociable person. I always try to be in touch with the situation. So, I think that a profession of a journalist suits me most and I have several reasons for this. 
First, a profession of journalist is by far the most interesting one for me. It is always great to learn all the news and to find out some facts that are not open to general public. Secondly, I want to learn how to use words correctly. Unfortunately, nowadays there is too much false information on the Internet. May aim is to tell people true facts about our world. Thirdly, I want to make changes in my lovely country. 
Unfortunately my parents can’t afford full tuition at AUCA. My family is pretty big, which consists of 6 people. So I need a KIVA loan, because it will help me to think about education, to study well and not to think about finance.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 45 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Dolores is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to pay for the laborers salaries and to buy additional fertilizer.

Dolores has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from direct selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries and buy additional fertilizer

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Халима 54-летняя замужняя женщина. Она родом из района Шахритус. В данный момент Халима нигде не работает, но хочет начать собственный торговый бизнес и быть независимой женщиной. У Халимы имеется опыт в продажах. Она уже приобрела торговую точка на рынке. Халима планирует заняться там продажей женской одежды. Таким образом у нее появится источник дохода и тем самым она улучшит свои жизненные условия. 
   К сожалению, у Халимы недостаточно собственного сбережения чтобы купить товар. Она просит кредит для закупа теплых женских платьев, свитеров, джинсов и другой сезонной одежды. Халима надеется на вашу отзывчивость!
texts.en:
Halima is 54-year-old married woman. She is a native of the Shahrituz district. She currently does not work anywhere, but wants to start her own retail business and be an independent woman. Halima has sales experience. She has already bought her shop location at the market. Halima plans to sell women's clothing there. As result, she will have a source of income and at the same time, improve her living conditions. 
 
Unfortunately, Halima does not have enough personal savings to buy products to sell. She is requesting a loan to buy warm women's dresses, sweaters, jeans and other seasonal clothing. Halima relies on your kind-heartedness!

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing to start her retail business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to Beth.  They have six children, all are in school.

John has an agrovet business in Ndunyu Njeru that he has operated for one year.  He has applied for a first loan from Kadet ltd to enable him buy more stocks of veterinary items for his business.  With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy chickens for rearing to add to his income.

He hopes to expand his business to improve the living standards of his family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy chickens for rearing

loans.name: Zaynullo

texts.ru: Зайнулло из села Кубадиён. Он в течение нескольких лет работает рабочим на стройке. В Кубодиёне зимой очень холодно, а летом не выносимо жарко. Несмотря на такой климат в этой области жители ремонтируют и строят дома летом, потому что летом сухо и светло. И потому что у них нет выбора. Зимой везде сыро и холодно. Зайнулло работает только по сезонам. То есть на зиму у него нет работы и соответственно нет дохода. Зайнулло дополнительно хочет заняться животноводством. Он собирается закупить несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и держать их в коровнике. По этой причине он берет кредит. Зайнулло надеется, что такая работа принесет ему доход и процветание семье...
texts.en:
Zaynullo is from the village of Qubadiyon. He has worked as a construction worker for several years. In Qubadiyon, the winter is very cold and the summer is unbearably hot. In spite of the climate, residents of this district renovate and build houses in the summer, because in the summer it is dry and light outside. And also because they don't have a choice. In winter, it is damp and cold everywhere. Zaynullo only works seasonally. That is to say, he doesn't work in the winter and, as a result, does not have an income. 

Zaynullo wants to additionally take up animal husbandry. He is planning to buy several cows and keep them in a barn. For this reason he is taking out a loan. Zaynullo hopes that this work will bring him earnings and will bring prosperity to his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start his animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Mngumi

texts.en:
Mngumi is 27 years old, male and married. He has two children 7 and 4 years old whom he supports. Mngumi runs a 'boda boda' (motorbike) business which he has run for three years now and operates it within Malindi. He earns a monthly income of Ksh. 5000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member and he is taking out a first loan from Kadet of Ksh.15,000 which he intends to use to service his motorbike.

Mngumi.will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike thus expanding his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business are for it to expand and also to make sure his children get a better education and live well.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra de 42 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales estudian. Lleva 10 años de trabajar en compra de leche para hacer cuajada, por las mañanas sale a comprar la leche a algunos vecinos que tienen vacas, luego regresa a casa y le hecha cuajo a la leche, después de cierto tiempo, procede a sacar la cuajada, la pone en un recipiente grande y la lleva a entregar a otras clientes que la revenden, para ello debe salir en autobús desde su comunidad hasta la carretera principal, ahí aborda otro autobús y viaja a la ciudad, para entregar su producto y también le vende a varios vecinos en la comunidad. 

 Sandra, solicita $300.00, para comprar algunos utensilios para su trabajo, y para invertir en compra de mas leche, ya que las cantidades que actualmente compra no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  

Al comprar mayor cantidad de leche, sus ingresos serán mayores y además podrá suplir las demandas de su clientela.

Ella esta planificando ahorrar, para que sus hijos continúen estudiando en la universidad, ya que están en bachillerato.
texts.en:
Sandra is 42 years and has a partner and four children who are studying. She has worked for ten years buying milk to make curd. In the morning she goes out to buy milk from some neighbours who have cows and then she comes back home and leaves the milk to curdle. After some time has passed she takes out the curd and puts it into a big container which she delivers to other customers who then resell it. To do this she has to take the bus from her town to the main highway where she gets on another bus and travels to the city to deliver her product and also sell it to various neighbours in the community.

Sandra is applying for a loan of $300 to purchase some utensils for her job and invest in the purchase of more milk, since the quantity she is currently buying isn't enough to satisfy customer demand. Purchasing a larger quantity of milk means her income will also increase and she will be able to meet the demands of her customers. Sandra is planning to save so that her children can continue studying at university as they are in their last year of high school.

loans.use: to buy some utensils for her job and invest in the purchase of more milk

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
23 de octubre está en su 5to. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, y deben seguir trabajando para mejorar.
Sabina es parte de este grupo, quien por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, también le es de mucha ayuda las capacitaciones que recibe. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, y que según comenta es muy apreciado por sus clientes. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, harina y demás, ya que quiere seguir con sus ventas y deleitar de esa forma a sus clientes y también ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“23 de octubre” is in its fifth cycle of the Women Committee Program. They took part in the poverty elimination survey and two of them were found to be below the poverty line, which means they have a low income and must continue working to improve.

Sabina is a member of this group, who is getting ahead through hard work and sacrifice. She finds the training workshops very helpful. She sells food that she prepares, and her customers like it, according to her. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make her foods, such as vegetables, beef, chicken and flour. She also wants to continue with her business, delight her customers and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, beef, chicken, flour, etc.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a 55-year-old farmer. She also rears poultry for sale. She is a single mother of one child. 

Scholastica has been practising farming for the past five years, with a monthly income of ksh 20,000, which she uses to meet the needs of her child. 

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy animal feed and one bull cow. 

With the expected profit from the farm, she will buy another piece of land to start land farming. 

Her hope and dream is to become a wholesale milk distributor.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and one bull cow.

loans.name: Cesia Marleny

texts.es:
Cesia, joven de 19 años de edad, esta acompañada y todavía no tiene hijos, trabaja como empleada domestica de lunes a viernes y el día sábado, le dan permiso ya que estudia tercer año de bachillerato a distancia, el día domingo, lo utiliza para dedicarse a las labores de su hogar, lavar la ropa, planchar y otras actividades.

 Esta muy contenta, ya que el año escolar no a terminado y por sus buenas notas, se siente segura de que aprobara el tercer año de bachillerato y estará lista para continuar sus estudios, con pobreza y mucho sacrificio, pero con muchas ganas de superarse.    

 Cesia, solicita $600.00, para comprar laminas y mejorar el techo de su casa y otra parte será utilizada para algunos gastos de sus estudios. Podrá realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, lo que ayudara a que pueda vivir mas segura y tranquila, además cubrirá algunos gastos de su estudio.   

Cesia, sueña con graduarse como licenciada en idiomas y estudiar mucho para lograr conseguir alguna beca, para  financiar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cesia is a 19 year old young woman who has a partner and does not have children yet. She works as a housekeeper from Monday to Friday. She is allowed the day off on Saturday since she is studying her third year of highschool by correspondence, while the Sunday is dedicated to household chores, washing the clothes, ironing, and other activities.

Cesia is very happy since the school year has not finished but judging by her good marks she feels certain that she will pass the third year of high school and be ready to continue with her studies, albeit poor and with a lot of sacrifice, but with a great desire to excel. 

Cesia is requesting $600 to purchase metal sheets to improve the roof of her house, while another part will be used to cover some of her study fees. She will be able to make some home improvements which would help her to live more safely and peacefully, as well as being able to cover some of her study fees.  

Cesia dreams of graduating with a degree in languages and studying a lot to obtain a scholarship to finance her studies.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets to improve the roof of her home, as well as using another part for some of her study fees

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a lady of twenty-seven, married to Titus and a mother of two children. She sells charcoal in Kiambu and has been in this business for eight years now. She gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Sara's third loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal in bulk for her business. In future she wants to be a prosperous business lady.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она шьёт национальные платья и имеет в этой сфере большой опыт. Зебо замужем за доброго человека. Ее муж является мастером по ремонту дома. Зебо и ее муж всегда мечтали, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и стали уважаемыми людьми. Ее сын Пулодчон в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Он учится в факультете Таможенное дело. Зебо должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zebo is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is married and is raising three children. She sews ethnic dresses and has a lot of experience in this field of work. Zebo is married to a good man. Her husband is a home renovation specialist. Zebo and her husband always dreamed that their children would receive a higher education and become respected individuals. This year, her son Pulodjon graduated from secondary school and entered into Tajik State University of Politics and Business. He is studying in the Customs Procedures department. Zebo needs to pay for his tuition and for that reason she is requesting a loan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado,  no continuo estudiando, debido al conflicto de la guerra. Él esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya no viven con él, pues cada uno formo su propio hogar, solo vive en casa el que tiene dos años,su compañera trabaja con él en la agricultura, y nadie más vive con ellos.

 Luis, se dedica  a  la agricultura desde  que tenia 8 años, con su papá a prendió el oficio.
