Él nos contó que su padre le decía que era mejor aprender  a trabajar y que así, podría mantener su hogar cuando se acompañara, hoy en parte agradece a su padre, por que le ha servido para ganarse la vida; pero hoy cree que si hubiere estudiado tendría mejores oportunidades, además, de la agricultura se dedica a cuidar unas 4 vacas que tiene. Su día comienza a las 4:AM, mientras ordeña sus vacas, su señora le prepara el café y su desayuno, para después llevar el ganado al potrero, y quedarse trabajando, unas 6 horas.

El préstamo sera utilizado, en la compra de un toro para las vacas y otra parte para comprar  4 sacos de  abono, para beneficiar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Su sueño es poseer unas 20 vacas lecheras, y así tener para su comida, construir su casa de ladrillo, ya que hoy donde vive esta serrada de madera, además, sueña que su ultimo hijo sea un profesional, pues los otros no quisieron.
texts.en:
48-year-old Luis studied up to the fourth grade. He could not continue studying because of the war. He is in a relationship and has five children. Four of them do not live with him; they have their own families. He lives with his two-year-old child and his partner, who works with him in agriculture.

Luis has worked in agriculture since he was eight, taught by his father. He says that his father told him that it was better to learn how to work in order to maintain his family once he got married. Today, he thanks his father because he can make a living, but he thinks that if he had studied, he would have more opportunities. He also owns four cows. His day starts at 4 am. While he milks the cows, his wife prepares coffee and breakfast. He then takes the cows to graze and continues with his activities for around six hours.

Luis will use the loan to buy a bull for his cows and to buy four bags of compost for a 7,000 m2 plot planted with corn. His dream is to have twenty milk cows that can provide food for the family. He also wants to build a brick house, since he lives in a wooden one at the moment. Finally, he would like to see his youngest son become a professional, since the other children did not want to.

loans.use: to buy a bull for his cows and four bags of compost for his corn plantations.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 11 se encuentra este grupo llamado Las Amigas, que como su nombre lo dice, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas, que quieren ayudarse para salir adelante e ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias.
Catalina quien es parte de este grupo cuenta que vende de productos de belleza, también se dedica a la peluquería en su casa y a la venta de productos de limpieza. Se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que hace ella, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora, que sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando y luchando.
La Sra. Catalina  pide de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, cremas y demás, la ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio. Ella está contenta por la oportunidad que están recibiendo todas.
texts.en:
The group called Las Amigas is in its 11th cycle. As it names implies, they are all friends and neighbors who want to help each other get ahead and improve their and their families' lives.  

Catalina, who is a part of this group, says that she sells beauty products and also has a hair salon in her house and sells cleaning products. The big effort she makes must be noted. She is a very hardworking woman who knows that the only way to get ahead is working and struggling. 

Catalina is asking for this loan to buy materials for his hair salon, such as shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more. It will help her to firm up her business plan. She is happy for the opportunity that all of them are receiving.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, creams and more.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is single and she lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past 3 years she has operated a food stall business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business, and she dreams of establishing a big shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old, a female and married. She has one one child who is three years old who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer and she has an Mpesa shop. She has been in this business for one year; her business is located in Kijiwetanga. In her business she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her second loan of KES 40,000 which she intends to use to add more float to her business. Fatuma will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family is to grow her business and educate her child.

loans.use: To add more float to her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has operated a clothes selling business, selling Khangas (women's wrap cloth) from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and competition. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. In addition, she operates a nursery school to supplement her income. 

With the KES 30,000 loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes (Khangas) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she says thank you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes (Khangas) for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 29-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself as committed. He operates a transport business; he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area fit for the business, and his primary customers are daily travelers. He says his biggest business challenge is harsh government policies. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts, to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to be stable and successful, within five years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP - DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Semporiana

texts.en:
Semporiana runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Semporiana is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to expand the variety of her stocks thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Semporiana hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old man from Kombok in Migori county which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He supports 4 people in his family and is married to Achieng.  Together they have 5 children who are aged between 6 and 1 year respectively.

Charles has a tailoring shop, which he has been operating for the last 10 years, He currently generates a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

Charles has requested for his fifth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to expand his tailoring business by purchasing more materials in different prints and design for making clothes. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children.

His dream is to have a better future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials in different prints and designs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is from Nyahururu. He is 27 years old and married to Mary, who is a farmer. They have two children, ages four and one year of whom the four year old is already enrolled in baby class.

Joseph is a dairy farmer who supplies milk to his neighbors. To assist him in making more money from milk sales, he has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which he shall use to buy another dairy cow.

Right now, his monthly income from milk sales is KES 100,000, and he intends to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to buy even more dairy cows.

Joseph's hope and dream for his future business is to be the main milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a 24-year-old single M-pesa agent. Rosaline has been operating her M-pesa for the past nine months with a monthly income of KSH 10,000, which she uses to meet her needs. 

Rosaline is applying for her first loan from KADET. She will use the loan to boost her business by increasing her M-pesa float to meet the needs of her clients. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will further her education as well as repay her loan. 

Rosaline's hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To increase her M-pesa float

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis es un productor de café orgánico y es socio de la "Unión Regional", asociación a la que entrega toda su producción año con año para que sea procesada y exportada, razón por la cual el siempre está al pendiente de su finca, pues su café debe ser de la mejor calidad. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito que utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar algunos gastos que se generan por la cosecha como son transporte y trabajadores.
texts.en: José Luis is an organic coffee farmer and a member of the "Unión Regional", an association that delivers all of its product year after year to be processed and exported. That is why he is always watching over his farm, because his coffee has to be of the best quality. For this harvest he needs a loan that he will use to buy fertilizer and to pay for some expenses generated by the harvest, such as transportation and workers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee cutters.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 43 years old and married to Lonkisa, a farmer. Her children are aged between 1 year and 15 years of age. She buys and sells cereals to earn a living and makes a monthly income of approximately 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). Rosemary learned about KADET from some women in the market who are already being financed by KADET LTD.

Rosemary has been advaced her fourth loan of 40,000 KES, which she will use to buy more cereals for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to cater for her family's basic needs and educate her children. She hopes to own rental houses in the future. Rosemary is a hardworking lady who is determined to meet her goals with the necessary financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 42 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She runs a primary school that has been in operation for 6 years now. Salome makes a monthly income of KES 17,000.

This is Salome's 5th loan and she will use it to renovate the school. She will buy more desks, build classrooms and buy more learning materials. She will use her profits to add more classrooms as a way of expanding her school. She paid all her previous loans successfully. 

Salome's future hopes and dreams are for her school to grow to a college level.

loans.use: to renovate her school.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old and has been running his mechanical services and tyre business for 20 years now. He is married and has two children.

This is his sixth loan term and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of vehicle tyres and tubes to sell. Paul anticipates making more income with which he will invest in livestock and cash crop farming. 

In future, Paul hopes to educate his children and grow his business.

loans.use: To buy tyres to sell.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice lives in Kilifi, which is north of Mombasa Kenya. He is a 36-year-old married businessman with four children. He runs a tailoring shop in Kilifi and he has been doing this business for more than ten years. He is the sole income earner for the family and he works everyday to make sure the business succeeds. He started the business from his own savings. 

Maurice learned of Milango Financial Services through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy cloth materials, threads and needles for the business. He hopes that in the next five years his business will grow into wholesale business dealing in all kinds of clothing. He will use the extra income that he will raise to expand his operations.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials, threads and needles,

loans.name: Marisol Elena

texts.es:
Cliente de 45 años de edad su nombre es Marisol,  vive en la ciudad de Latacunga en un barrio casi céntrico de la ciudad este barrio se llama El Calvario, barrio muy querido y reconocido por los habitantes, ya que aquí posa la imagen de la virgen más querida de los Latacungueños La Virgen De la Merced, aquí vive con sus dos hijos Sebastián y Julián ya jóvenes a quienes ha tenido que sacar adelante sola, ya que el padre de sus hijos nunca se hizo responsable  de ellos, Marisol ha tenido que pasar muchas necesidades, humillaciones pero esto nunca ha sido obstáculo para luchar por sus hijos y ahora son ellos quienes la acompañan y ven por ella, en vista de todas las necesidades que han tenido que pasar se ha visto obligada a buscar la manera de subsistir y es por eso que en la venta de edredones, piyamas, sábanas etc., ha encontrado la mejor manera de salir adelante, ya que no cuenta con un horario fijo y esto ayuda a que puedan pasar juntos más tiempo, además de todo esto la señora Marisol García no solo es madre es amiga de sus hijos,  también tiene ingresos adicionales por la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, 
Marisol solicita un crédito que le permitirá tener más variedad en el stock de mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes para que con las utilidades adicionales que se generen poder terminar un tratamiento médico que lo ha estado haciendo desde hace un tiempo atrás, pero que por falta de dinero no lo ha podido hacer, razón por la cual Marisol y sus dos hijos quieren agradecer muchísimo a quienes forman parte de esta noble institución quienes le han abierto las puertas para poder cumplir con su necesidad, es por eso que agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida personal y familiar.
texts.en:
This client is 45 years old and is named Marisol. She lives in the city of Latacunga in a town called El Calvario, which is almost in the centre of the city. This town is much loved and appreciated by its inhabitants, since it is here that the Latacunga community's most loved image of the virgin, La Virgen De la Merced, is found.

Marisol lives here with her two sons, Sebastián and Julián, who are already young adults. She had to bring them up alone as the father of her children never took responsibility for them. Marisol has had to go without and suffer humiliation, but fighting for her children has never been an obstacle and now they keep her company and look after her. As she had to do without many necessities, Marisol was forced to find a way to survive and that is the reason why she was able to find the best way of getting ahead by selling quilts, pyjamas, sheets, etc. She does not have a fixed timetable and this helps her to spend more time together with her children. After all, Ms Marisol García is not only the mother of her children but also their friend. In addition, she gets extra income selling beauty products from a catalogue.

Marisol is applying for a loan that will allow her to have a greater variety of stock and merchandise to offer her customers. With the additional profit that she makes she will be able to finish the course of medical treatment she has been undergoing for a while now, as due to a lack of money she has been unable to finish it. For this reason Marisol and her two children would like to thank those who form part of this noble institution very much as well as those who have opened their doors so that she can meet her needs. She gives thanks to Fundación Alternativa in Equador and to Kiva for making the development of her personal and family life possible.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and vary her stock

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 53-year-old married woman with ten children. She makes and sells pop-corn in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Tina needs a loan to buy sack of corn, cooking oil,flour,sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to extend and improve her business.Tina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of corn, cooking oil, flour, sugar and plastic bags.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of them are currently in school. For the past eight years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sell clothes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve business by buying more clothes to sell, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to buy things the family needs. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve business by buying more clothes to sell

loans.name: Los Tuices Group

texts.es:
El señor Andres es soltero. Cuenta con 54 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Se dedica a la confección de playeras. Inició este negocio comprando una máquina y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de una máquina plana para la confeccion de playeras. En el futuro desea contar con un taller con varios operadores y tener un local propio.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la confección y venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Andres is single, 54 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. He makes t-shirts for a living. He began his business by buying a sewing machine and to date he has five years experience in this line of work. 

Andres formed a group and requested a loan that he will use to buy a flat sewing machine to make t-shirts. In the future he would like to have a workshop with many workers and have his own store.

The other members of the group work making and selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make t-shirts

loans.name: Ahoumba

texts.fr: Ahoumba est une femme âgée de 43ans mariée à un imprimeur avec deux enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 15ans et le dernier de 13ans. Elle est revend des produits d´alimentation générale et articles scolaires à toutes personnes. Elle sollicite un second prêt chez WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l'aidera à ouvrir une deuxième boutique et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: Ahoumba is a 43 year old woman who is married to a man working in the printing industry, with whom she has two children aged 15 and 13. She sells food products and school supplies to a variety of customers. She is asking for her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase additional material to sell. Profits will help her in opening a second store as well as take care of the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase food products and school supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a permanent resident of kitebero, a village in Mbarara district, age 38 years old. He is a commercial farmer and married with six children and two dependents from his uncle, who died four years ago. 

All of his children and dependents are in school. From childhood, he has been a farmer dealing in banana sales until 2008, when he learned about the services of Ugafode micro-finance, which funded him with a loan of ugx.2,000,000 to improve on his plantations. 

This made him prosper in life and even managed to build a semi permanent house to accommodate his family. He is requesting a loan ugx.3,000,000 to complete his house and buy solar energy for his home, since he is located in the village where there is no hydro power.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house and solar energy for his home.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 28 years old and has two children. Evalyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Evalyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evalyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, 37, is a mother of three children. According to her, she will be the happiest mother if all of her three children could finish their studies. Hardship and difficulties push her to strive hard in her charcoal sales business. 

Analiza desires to generate higher sales and profit. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 which will be used to purchase charcoal and piglets for her new hog-fattening business. She hopes that through her loan and determination she can improve her lifestyle and financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and piglets for her retail business.

loans.name: Nelci

texts.en:
Nelci, a 30-year-old single parent, lives with her children. Nelci has been running a kiosk business for the past three years. The income generated from this business enables her to meet their living expenses and school fees. 

Currently, Nelci wants to improve her business by adding to the stock at the kiosk. By selling more items, she can generate more income. Therefore, she requests a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM.  The loan will be spent on a display cabinet and more stock such as sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and instant noodles, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a new display cabinet and more stock such as sugar, coffee, shampoo, bath soap, detergent and instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta has a tailoring business in Nairobi town and has been running it for the last 19 years. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more sewing materials for use in her business. These include textile materials of different types as well as threads and buttons. She will use the anticipated income to open another tailoring business. This is her sixth loan term and she paid back all her previous loan successfully.

She hopes to become successful in her business and enable her children to achieve the best education and live a successful life in future.

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing.

loans.name: Chiquito

texts.en:
Chiquito resides in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, he grows and harvests coconuts and sells them in the town while his wife sells seafood in the market. Having five children is not easy, so he works twice as hard to try and earn income for the family. He plans to plant vegetables on his farm to earn more money. 

He took a new loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. He dreams of having a successful farm and being able to support the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda has been pig fattening for 24 years and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ausberto

texts.es:
Ausberto de 34 años de edad, solo estudio  primer grado, esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa,  tiene dos hijos, y están estudiando.   

Él  es barbero de profesión y lo ejerce desde hace 7 años, su papá fue quien le enseño el trabajo. Antes de ser barbero,trabajo en la agricultura. Además, trabajo 5 años en una maquila, pero le tocaba viajar lejos y no tenia casi tiempo para su familia,  un día que se encontraba preocupado por que no tenia nada para su familia,se acordó de las palabras que le dijo su padre. “Esto te va ha servir, cuando tengas tu hogar”, y hoy agradece lo que su padre le enseño con ese trabajo, esta sacando a delante a su familia, y lo mejor es que pasa más tiempo con ellos. Su horario es desde las 7: 00 AM, hasta las 2:30 PM porque después se va con su familia para la iglesia.       

El préstamo sera invertido en la compra de una docena y media de lamina, y madera para construir su casa porque donde hoy vive, no es de él. Su sueño, es poder cancelar el crédito, para tener las puertas abiertas, porque su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo y ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ausberto is 34 years old. He only went to school through the first grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has two children and they are in school.   

He is a barber by trade and has done this for 7 years. His father was the one who taught him this work.  Before becoming a barber, he worked as a farmer. In addition,  he worked in a factory, but he had to commute a long way and he barely had time with his family. One day, he was worried because he had nothing for his family. He remembered his father's words: "this will be useful for you when you have a home". Today he is grateful that his father taught him this work. He is getting his family ahead and the best thing is that he spends more time with them.  His schedule is from 7: 00 AM till 2:30 PM, because later he goes to church with his family.       

The loan will be invested in buying a dozen and a half of sheeting and wood to build his house because where he lives now isn't his. His dream is to pay off the loan to keep his doors open. His dream is to build a brick house and for his children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy a dozen and a half of sheeting, and wood to build his house because where he lives now isn't his.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a 49-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. The oldest child is 25 while the youngest is 6 years old. Rufa engages in farming. She grows and sells rice as a source of income. Her farming business started more than 10 years ago. 

Rufa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay a laborer's fee to yield more harvest.

In the future, Rufa hopes to expand her farming business and invest in another business to provide additional income so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers, medicines and pay a laborer's fee.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 36 years old, a shopkeeper, and a single mother to one child. Carolyne has been running her shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to provide for her family. 

Carolyne is applying for her first loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to stock her shop with more commodities like fruits in season and small-scale home products. With the anticipated profit from the business she will be able to expand her business and get commodities in large-scale.

Carolyne's hopes and dreams are to be a wholesale distributor in the near future.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more commodites

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan  de 30 años de edad, solo estudio 4° grado, debido que su papá no vio importante el estudio.  él esta acompañado, y su pareja trabaja con él en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos,el mayor ya esta en la escuela.

 Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia unos 10 años, pues su padre siempre lo llevo a trabajar en la siembra de maíz, y fue con él que aprendió el oficio. Además, de trabajar en la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, también cuida unas 3 vacas que tiene, pues siempre le a gustado tener animales, ya que de ellos sale para el sustento del hogar.


 Se levanta muy temprano, para ordeñar sus vacas y luego irse a trabajar, su  compañera es la que lleva el ganado al potrero,para que él logre el día, su vida es un poco agitada pero agradece a Dios por todo lo ha dado.   


El crédito, sera invertido en la compra de unos 4 terneros para repasto, ya que  después que sale de la cosecha queda el rastrojo para el ganado y es una manera de ganar unos dolares.

Su sueño, es tener un día una 10 vacas lecheras,ver a sus hijos graduarse en una profesión, comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, ya que donde vive es de un hermano.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old and only studied up until the fourth grade, as his father didn't think that his studies were important. Juan has a partner who works in agriculture and two children, the oldest being now at school.

Juan has worked in agriculture since he was about 10 years old. His father always took him to work when they were planting maize, which is when he learnt how to do this job. In addition to planting maize, beans and sorghum, Juan also takes care of three cows. He has always liked having animals since they provide a way of sustaining the home.

Juan gets up very early to milk the cows and later goes to work. His partner is the one who leads the cattle to pasture. Getting through the day is a bit stressful, but he gives thanks to God for everything He has given him.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of four calves to fatten up, since after the harvest the stubble is left over for the cattle and it's a way to make some money.

Juan's dream is to one day have 10 dairy cows, see his children graduate as professionals, and buy a plot of land and build his own house, as he currently lives in his brother's house.

loans.use: to buy four calves to fatten up

loans.name: Dusenge-Dukore Group

texts.fr:
Ernest  fait partie du groupe  Dusenge-Dukore  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 32 ans et est marié  à Annociate, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 9 ans, dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge 1 orphelin qui étudie.

Il  fait le commerce des habits  depuis 8 ans. 

Il est son  dixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il   obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  320  habits  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Ernest is a member of the Dusenge-Dukore group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and married to Annonciate, a farmer. Together, they have three children between the ages of 4 and 9, two of whom attend school. He is also responsible for one orphan, who attends school. He has been selling clothing for the past eight years. He is asking for his second loan from Turame, which will allow him to increase his working capital and purchase 320 outfits to sell. In the coming years, he hopes to purchase a plot of land and watch his children become educated.

loans.use: increase his working capital and purchase 320 outfits to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 and has a tricycle which is operated by her husband while she is engaged in selling fish as an additional source of her family income. She and her husband work together to improve their living conditions. The couple both wants to let their three children finish their studies and achieve their dreams in life.

To realize her goals, Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy oil and steel parts. A part of the loan will also be used to buy fish. She hopes that this loan will strengthen her transportation and fish selling businesses and make them profitable and productive. In this way, she could further improve her financial status and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy oil, steel parts and fish.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 29 years old and married with three children who are in school. Genelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genelyn runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Genelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 56-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children.The youngest child is 19. She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice as her main source income. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay labor fees so that she can get a bigger yield.  

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, medicines and pay laborer fees.

loans.name: Najuka

texts.en:
Najuka is a 35-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Parsha tole in Kalaiya Municipality of Bara district Nepal. She was married at the age of twenty seven and started the sewing occupation in her own home in the initial years. As demand for her work started peaking, she set up her tailoring shop with the assistance of credit from Nirdhan Utthan Bank Ltd. Now she has an additional four sewing machines in her tailoring shop. 

Najuka wants to set up another tailoring shop in her village so she has requested NPR 20,000 to buy a sewing machine and set up the tailoring shop. 

Najuka has earned local community respect. She wants to inspire fellow women to be entrepreneurs in her village and hopes to give good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for setting up a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ginalyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce, salts, etc. to sell.

Ginalyn has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce and salts to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salary during the sugarcane harvest. 

Fely has been in this business for 13 years. Fely earns additional income from raising pigs.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salary during harvest.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
For four years in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Liza, a 44-year-old married mother of two, has made a living by operating a retail store. She sells a variety of food and home-use products, earning 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. Her husband is a farmer, their main source of income. 

Her costumers have requested that she get additional products to sell; she was encouraged to buy feed and rice to sell, in addition to her other stock.

In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Her previous loan, used in the business, was successfully repaid. 

Now she is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Umoja - Daraja Group

texts.en:
Judy, who is in her early 40s, is single with a boy and a girl who are in school. Since 1998, Judy has been managing her life by running a business selling second-hand clothes; she is doing great in her business. Judy works from 08am to 08pm each working day, and is able to earn a good return from this activity. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Judy used her previous loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She used her profit to cover school fees, food expenses for her family, and reinvested back to her business. 

Judy will use this loan to buy more clothes to sell to more people. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a mini-supermarket.  

She will share this loan with her loan group " UMOJA-DARAJA" which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janalyn

texts.en:
Janalyn is 41 years old and has four children. She is married, and has three children who are in school.

Janalyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines; she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Janalyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo is a 34-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, giant plants and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Alaimalo has requested a loan to to buy bush knives, crowbar, weed killer and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Alaimalo hopes to improve her business and support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, crowbar, weed killer and chemicals

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas lleva por nombre este grupo de Encarnación, el cual, gracias a su esfuerzo están en el sexto ciclo del programa de comités, recibiendo capacitaciones e instrucciones de como invertir sus créditos. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una puede saber su situación de pobreza y conforme a eso poder trabajar y mejorar.
Cynthia es una de ellas, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien vende ropas y zapatos. Cuenta que al principio le costo un poco empezar con su trabajo, pero que hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela, hace también sobre pedidos y así esta saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Ella pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas de todo tipo, para poder ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes y también poder atraer a mas.
texts.en:
This group from Encarnacion calls themselves "Mujeres unidas" (Women united). Thanks to their efforts, this is their sixth loan cycle with the communal bank program, which empowers them and gives them instructions on how to invest their loan. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, through which each person can know their level of poverty and can work and improve accordingly.

Cynthia, one of the group, is a very hardworking person, who sells clothing and shoes. She tells in the beginning it was a little difficult for her to begin with her work, but that now she has very good customers and also fills orders. In this way she is getting ahead and helping her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in buying all types of clothing, in order to be able to offer a good variety to her clients and to also be able to attract more.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who has four children. She is 46 years old and resides at Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

Marieta owns and operates a charcoal business to earn a living and she's been in this business for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. In addition to this, she also buys charcoal to resell in bulk for a higher price. With this strategy, she will be able to earn more profit. Her previous loan from GDMPC was successfully repaid and recently, she borrowed a new loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase wood and charcoal to resell. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase wood and charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Jane is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cream, etc. for her food vending business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Knox

texts.en:
Mr. Knox and the entire REEP (Rural Economic Empowerment Program) fraternity wish to sincerely thank Kiva lenders for the previous loan. The loan enabled Knox to purchase solar lanterns which he sold to interested REEP members on short term loans, repayed with a small amount of interest. The beneficiaries of the lanterns have finished repaying their loans and now are happy they no longer have to spend money on kerosene. They recount that these lanterns are ideal for children to read and write by; they are portable for farmers to use to go about their daily chores after sunset; they are able to charge their mobile phones and brighten up their dwellings. 

The organization group membership has increased from 400 groups to 520 groups in the last one year. Among the products offered by REEP, solar lanterns have been the most successful product because of their huge economic and social value: cutting down the recurring paraffin costs and carbon emissions. 

Mr. Knox is determined to replace all the smoky unsafe candles and kerosene lamps among the members with the solar lanterns which offer bright and safe light and come with a mobile phone charging function. There is still a huge portion of the group without solar lanterns, so the demand is still very high for him to meet from his limited cash flow. Knox is therefore requesting a new loan to buy more lanterns for selling to the members. On the uploaded photo is Knox with Loice, a member of one of the new groups to join REEP.  She has just purchased a solar lamp on a loan from REEP.

loans.use: to buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena is a 31-year-old married woman. She has had a business selling milk for about five years. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Zundui

texts.en: Zundui is 59 years old and  lives with his wife in Ger, in a traditional nomadic tent in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Serjmaa helps her husband to run their family business of agriculture. Their children are married and live apart with their own families. Zundui and his wife have been operating an organic vegetable and wheat growing business for more than twenty years. He also helps and supports newly starting businesses to prepare their planting, etc. His wife sells organic vegetables and barley flour in the local market. He is requesting 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolia Tughriks) to purchase wheat harvesting equipment for his business. He is a hardworking, honest, and helpful man.

loans.use: to purchase wheat harvesting equipment for his business

loans.name: Borjin

texts.en: Mr. Borjin is 32 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Bayantsetseg runs a small tailoring business at home. Borjin has been driving a heavy truck since he was 18 and has been providing transportation services by rented vehicle until 2012. At that time he purchased his own truck, and he continues to provide transportation services to make a living. His truck needs to have the tires replaced otherwise he will have to temporarily stop his business. He is now requesting a loan of 750,000 MNT to purchase a set of tires to replace his old ones to continue providing his transportation service. He is a hardworking, diligent and reasonable man.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires to replace his old ones to continue providing his transportation service

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee and milk to sell in her general store business.

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years. She also earns income from farming sugarcane.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, coffee and milk to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is running a general store while his wife is working a a teacher. He has been in this business for more than five years as an aid to his wife's income. He borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase livestock feed, rice and dried fish for sale. He plans to save a portion of his profit for future family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed, rice and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Chroeurn

texts.en:
Chroeurn (pictured at home) hopes to continue his studying. He is in his first semester of his second year. Hence he decided to apply for a second education loan to pay his school fees.

Chroeurn is single and lives with his parents, brother and sister in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His parents are rice farmers; his brother is a fisherman and his sister is a garment worker.

loans.use: To pay his school fees.

loans.name: Hishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Hishigsuren is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.

Her husband Ganbold works at a local company as a welder. Her daughters both attend local schools. 

Hishigsuren has been working as hairdresser in a barber shop since 2007 and has regular clients. She is now planning to open her own small barber shop and employ 2 or 3 other hairdressers to start her business. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials and equipment to renovate her workplace and start her business. She is a hardworking, diligent and welcoming lady.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and equipment to renovate her workplace and start her business

loans.name: Urcilina

texts.en:
Urcilina is a 55-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has 10 children. The youngest child is 14. 

She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. Her business started more than 10 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to pay for fertilizers and laborer's fee in order to gain more harvest and meet the family's daily needs.
  
In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and laborer's fee.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 27 years old and married to Violet. He supports three members of the family. 

He runs a tailoring shop and is also a farmer. He has operated these businesses for four years, and currently gets a monthly income is ksh 6,000.

Joshua is borrowing a loan of ksh 30,000, which he intends to use to purchase more stock of materials for his tailoring business. This is his second loan; he successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of materials

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money for her cloth selling business. Beside the cloth selling business, she prepares meat goat soup and sells to her customers. She prepares meat goat soup using goat heads and legs.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.The loan of KSH 50,000 she is requesting will help her to purchase more goat heads and legs for her business

loans.use: To purchase more goat heads and legs for her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffalos and five goats, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also deals in the business of animal sales and purchases to generate an extra amount of profit.  Nasreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena is a 25-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for many years and is now an expert in the field. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer and does not earn enough to support his family well. Her hand skills are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 7 children and wants to grow her business to provide them with a quality lifestyle. Haseena has requested a loan of Rs 30,000, to buy raw materials such as sequins, beads, thread and stones in large varieties and quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use the profits on her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as sequins, beads, thread and stones in large varieties and quantities.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. 

Her embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business, so Naseem has requested a loan of Rs 25,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle, having a good credit repayment history. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. 

She would like to teach embroidery skills so they can help her expand her business, and also to earn money for themselves. In addition, she is interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has three buffaloes, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Kaneez has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Simkhan

texts.en: Simkhan is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village of Gardabani district. Simkhan is involved in agricultural activities. He works hard on the family-owned land growing maize and tomatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers at a good price. In addition, the family owns 3 cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. Simkhan decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $ 1100 for purchasing a used car to start a trading business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell in the capital city of Georgia. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a fruit and vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Preveen

texts.en: Preveen is 27 years old, a married woman and mother of seven children; one of her sons is shown in the photo and the man shown in the photo is Preveen’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of Rs 30,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Sialeia

texts.en:
Sialeia is a 53-year-old married woman with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing clothes. She has four years of experience in this line of business. 

Sialeia needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads and materials. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and support her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, threads and materials.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 31 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old, married and has four children.

Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from raising poultry. 

Mary requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

Mary has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like biscuits, sugar, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Nissa

texts.en:
Mary Nissa works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Mary Nissa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

Mary Nissa has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Mercelita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

Mercelita has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase a water pump for her business. Beside her fish-selling business, she also sells both men's and women's clothes. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more bales of clothes for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
This is Mejumaa. She previously accessed a loan that she used to renovate her business premises.

She would like to apply for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy food ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans, and onions for her business. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans and onions for her business.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 42-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. 

Nasreen is a motivated mother of five and is liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of PKR 30,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use the part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantity.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. 

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 22-year old entrepreneur living in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. He recently moved out of his family's home to live on his own, but he has found that the going has not been easy due to unemployment. Nickson has tried out several small businesses as a means to fend for his food and a place to stay, but the money he earns is not enough to take care of all his needs. However, Nickson discovered Fresh Life toilets, and believes this business will pay for his living expenses.

Nickson seeks a loan to help him purchase two Fresh Life toilets, which he intends to run himself. He hopes that the business will generate enough to improve his living standards and create more employment opportunities for other youth.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme âgée de 45ans et mariée à un commerçant avec 3 enfants dont 2 sont à l’école. Elle est revendeuse ; elle revend des fruits (oranges, bananes) à tous clients. Elle vend au marché d’akodésséwa. Elle a commencé à exercer depuis 1993. Elle demande son premier prêt chez WAGES pour la vente des fruits et acheter un terrain. Elle envisage augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et assurer la bonne éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is a 45-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has three children, including two in school. She is a retailer and sells fruit (oranges and bananas) to all comers. She sells at the Akodésséwa market. She started operations in 1993. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to sell fruit and to purchase a plot of land. She envisions increasing her sales and ensuring the right education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruit (oranges and bananas)

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 54 years old and married with five children.

Merlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Merlyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Merlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is running a general store in the village of Oroquieta City, while her husband is earning as a seaman. She has been in this business for more than three years to make a living. Her income was good enough to support the needs of her three children. 

In order to improve the business, she borrowed a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase additional goods like canned items, cereal, milk, sugar and butter. She hopes to earn more income to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned items, cereal, milk, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from the town of Kobuleti, which is a Black Sea resort visited annually by Georgian and many former Soviet Union holidaymakers. She is 54 years old and lives alone in her own house. 

Rita earns a living through clothing sales. Specifically, she gets apparel from the local retailers and sells for a small profit among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores, Rita's business has a high demand. She is very nice to her customers and does her job with love and care. 

She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices and continue her business. Rita will be able to get more profit and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to purchase stock of apparel for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair oil and weaves.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Sokhom is 51 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia.  For the last 10 years, Sokhom has been raising pigs. She also sells coffee in the village. She earns about 50,000 KHR a day to meet the family’s needs.

Sokhom is the leader of her group.  They are requesting a loan from VisionFund. Sokhom will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feeds for nourishing them. She hopes this loan will fatten her pigs so she can make a living better.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. 

She has been running a business of cloth sales for many years. She purchases a variety of printed cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Balqees requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en:
Samreen is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for the past six years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also deals in a business of animal sales and purchase on a seasonal basis. 

At present, she has two buffaloes in milk. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales and ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: El Mantial Del Pariachi Group

texts.es: Julia de 36 años casada con 01 hijo dependiente, actualmente es socia   del grupo  “El Manantial De Pariachi”  constituida por 07 mujeres trabajadoras. Julia  cuenta con un restaurante en su vivienda, donde ofrece almuerzo todos los días de la semana pues cuenta con clientes fijos. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Julia ha terminado de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de insumos, pues comprará en mayores cantidades como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros productos y así poder preparar sus comidas.  Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. La Alcancía Comunal “El Manantial De Pariachi” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible esté crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Julia es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa negra y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old, married, with one dependent child. She is one of the seven hard-working woman who make up the "El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank. Julia has a restaurant in her house where she offers lunch every day of the week. She has regular clients. With the fruits of her labor Julia has finished building her house. 

Julia is requesting this loan to buy supplies like rice, sugar, pasta, etc. to prepare her meals. She will buy them in large quantities. Her wish is to continue growing her business. The "El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank thanks those that make this loan possible and promise to continue working hard. Julia is second to the right, wearing a black sweater and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Siulala

texts.en:
Siulala is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, papaya, cocoa and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Siulala has requested a loan to buy taro tubes, bush knives, weed killer, a crowbar and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, she hopes to support her family, her children's education and to improve her business as well.

loans.use: to buy taro tubes, bush knives, weed killer, a crowbar and chemicals.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Le grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” está conformada por 10 socias y socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio. Jaqueline tiene 41 años es conviviente con 02 hijos en el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. Hace muchos años implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. De esta  manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega y mejorar la fachada de su vivienda. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jaqueline  es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa de Lima Group is made up of ten members who work in various commercial activities.

Jaqueline, 41, lives with her partner and has two children.  She's the treasurer of the group.  Many years ago she set up a small grocery store in her home to help her husband with the children's school expenses.  Her greatest desire is to expand her store and improve the front of her house.

Jaqueline will invest the loan in rice, sugar, and oil.

The group's grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Jaqueline's the first person seated on the left; she wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Amaraa

texts.en:
Mrs. Amaraa is 51 years old and lives with her husband in a house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city in Mongolia. Her husband, Gombodorj, is 52 and operates a taxi service business. Her 3 children are married and live apart.

Amaraa has been running her butcher shop business in the local market since 2005. She is well-known for her friendly service and tasty meat products. She is now involving her husband in her business. He is starting to be in charge of purchasing meat products from a bigger market where herders sell their livestock. 

Amaraa is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts to repair her husband's car so he can use it for transporting her meat supply. Thus, he will be employed in her business. The Gombodorjs are a happy, hardworking and respected family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her husband's car to use as transportation of her meat supply and employ her husband in her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Mayas Group

texts.es:
La señora María Angelica es casada. Cuenta con 30 años de edad. De escolaridad 2do. primaria. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la fabricación de canastos. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concedío su madre y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar hilo para la fabricacion de canastos. Desea en el futuro tener mas capital de trabajo y un almacen de venta de canastos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa, elaboracion de bordados y canastas.

Una de las socias no pudo asistir a la reunion cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
María Angelica is 30 years old and is married. She has education up to second grade of primary school. She has 5 children and 3 of them are at school. María Angelica earns a living making baskets. She started her business with a small amount of capital which her mother gave her and has had the business for 10 years. She is the organizer of a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to buy thread for making the baskets. In the future she would like to have more capital and a store to sell the baskets. 

The other members of the group earn a living selling clothing, doing embroidery and making baskets. 

One of the members was unable to attend the meeting when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread for making baskets

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells nipa roofing in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She earns additional income from selling seafood. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase nipa roofing

loans.name: Sicelia

texts.en:
Sicelia appreciates for her previous loan that improved her living standards.Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used to stock her retail shop.

She also operates a vegetable stall beside the retail shop. She would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes and fruits for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, potatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is a 27-year-old single man, who has worked in an agricultural business for ten years. He has specialized in raising cattle in his own farm and trading the milk to support his family as he is their main breadwinner. Habib is responsible for the living of nine members of his family, that's why in 2011, he started his own business by opening his own farm.
Because of his family's increasing needs, Habib is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to start a new additional business to make sure that he can cover his family's needs in a better way. He will work as a blacksmith, and this loan will help him open his own shop where he can put all the equipment and tools he needs to make sure his business will develop easily.
He hopes to keep on expanding and developing both businesses to make sure he can respond better to his family's increasing financial needs.

loans.use: To start an additional income business to improve his family's living standards

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en:
Kayed is a 21-year-old, single man who works in collecting and selling metal scrap. He has been working in this domain for two years. He puts so much effort into developing his business to make sure that it will provide him with a good income to cover his needs and improve his living.
